loans.name: La Foi De Aculesamedi Group

texts.fr:
Delima est le coordinateur de son groupe La Foi de Aculesamedi. Il n'est pas mariee. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité.

Il dirige son commerce de vente de du charbon pendants les 9 derniers années. Avant de ce commercé ce commerce Il était enseignant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de La Foi de Aculesamedi ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défit principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir une plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera à voyagé dans des autre pays tel que panama.
texts.en:
Delima is the coordinator of the La Foi de Aculesamedi Group. He is not married. He lives in the north of Haitia, where electricity is rare and access to drinking water very limited. He has been running a business selling charcoal for the last nine years. Before going into this business, he used to be a teacher. He hopes that this loan will allow him to grow his business. 

Other members of the La Foi de Aculesamedi group need loans for their business such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, food items, charcoal etc. Delima says that his biggest challenge is to increase his sales volume. His main goal is to expand his business, which will allow him to travel to other countries, such as Panama.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, plantains, potatoes, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more batteries, soap, copy book, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз бизнесмен, проживающий в городе Истаравшан. Полтора года тому назад он брал кредит для своего бизнеса, для купли фужеров, наборов чашек и сервиза. Он благодарит Кредиторов KIVA за поддержку и сегодня снова обратился за повторным кредитом. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент товара в магазине, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. На сумму кредита Фируз хочет приобрести разнообразный набор посуды и сервиза. Он очень ценит свой бизнес, так как за счет его прибыли он обеспечивает свою семью. Фируз надеется, что и в этот раз его поддержат и он сможет расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Firuz is a businessman living in Istaravshan . Eighteen months ago, he took out a loan to buy wine glasses, cups, and tea services for his business. He is thankful to his Kiva lenders for their support, and is once again asking for a loan. He wants to increase the range of products in his store to attract more customers and thus increase sales. Firuz wants to use the money to buy a variety of dishes and tea services. He values his business since he is able to use the profit he makes to provide for his family. Firuz hopes that you support him this time, and he can expand his business.

loans.use: buy dishes and tea services to increase his sales.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a qualified midwife who decided to open up a drug shop so she could get money to take her children to good schools. She is an old borrower at UGAFODE Microfinance having borrowed five times. She is 46 years old and very determined to carry on her business until she gets her dream in life. 

Beatrice started the business in 1999 and is happy that the business has grown slowly but steadily. She works seven days a week and works 12 hours each day. Beatrice believes that if she gets the loan money, she will re-stock the drug shop. Her drug shop is located in the busiest trading center in Ishaka and she is hopeful that she will make profits from the business. Beatrice would like to buy drugs using the loan money so that she can ably serve her customers who are the patients who come from around Ishaka. 

Her hopes for the future include giving the children quality education so that they can compete favorably with other people on the job market. Her main challenges are the bad debtors who never pay and she says this affects her greatly.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is a 55-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has been operating a sari-sari store (general store) for more than 20 years now. She sells noodles, rice, canned goods, chips and seasoning to the people in her community. This is her source of income. Justina is applying for a loan worth 25,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, candies and cookies. This loan would be a great help for her especially because it will allow her to buy more stock to sell. Justina dreams of expanding her business in the future. She also plans on saving some of her income for future use.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, cups, plates, tubs, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fuel for resale.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Lilya is 46 years old and lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She works as a teacher of geography at the school. Lilya is married and has a son and a daughter. Her son studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical University at the last course and her daughter studies at the Yerevan State University at the faculty of history; she studies at the paid division. Her husband works at a private company as an expert. Despite the fact that Lilya and her husband are employed and they work very hard, they have some financial problems connected with paying of their daughter’s tuition fee.
She asks a loan of 165,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.en:
Sidonie is a 36-year-old single woman with a 10-year-old child who is in primary school. For the past four years, she has run a food stall in Cameroon. Sidonie is very stable and experienced and her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.

Sidonie is requesting a loan to buy pork to cook and sell. Her loan will increase her profit by fifty percent. Sidonie hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pork to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cement, sand, and water to increase her business volume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Graciela Leonor

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Graciela, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 7, 4 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es ebanista. 
Doña Graciela realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa, allí el realiza muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, entre otros productos, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos  almacenes de esas ciudades. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para elaborar obras de muy buena calidad.
Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera, pintura, selladores y otros materiales para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el Grupo De Crédito dos años  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa bien construida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "20 De Abril" meets once a fortnight in the Montecristo canton. The area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where Graciela lives. She is 30 years old and has a partner, with whom she has four children aged 12, 7, 4 and 3. The two older ones go to school. Her husband is a furniture maker.

Graciela is applying for the loan for her husband to use in his business. He has a furniture making workshop in his home. Here he does a lot of work in wood, making items such as chairs, doors, beds and other things. He works from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 5pm. He does work for customers who visit his workshop and also supplies some stores in the cities of Manta and Portoviejo. He buys the wood from a wood yard in Manta where he can find the wood he needs to do good quality work. 

They will use this loan to buy wood, paint, sealants and other materials for making his products. Graciela has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution offers. Her dreams are to have a well built house and to get on in life with her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sealants and other materials.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita tiene 51 años, proviene de una Familia de comerciantes ya que sus padres se dedicaban al comercio por ende ella les ayudaba.
Se animó y con la ayuda de su marido se independizo hace varios   años  en su propio negocio, comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela. Comenta además que aprendió mucho donde estaba como comerciante con sus padres y a la par aprendió de cómo administrar y llevar adelante un negocio.
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, bebidas, hortalizas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Doña Margarita, aged 51, is from a family of merchants and helped her parents run their shop. Several years ago, she became determined to go into business for herself, and with her husband's help, she opened her own shop. Doña Margarita reports that business at her shop is very good and she's built up a strong customer base. She also reflects that she learned a great deal from her parents, who taught her how to manage and grow a business. 

Doña Margarita is applying for a loan so that she can invest the funds in the purchase of various items to boost her inventory, such as vegetables, greens, meats, drinks, and other goods. A larger inventory will allow Doña Margarita to keep striving to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, greens, meats, drinks, and other goods.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esta esforzando por poder seguir trabajando y creciendo. Su préstamo anterior lo invirtió para el cambio de su vehículo, que le permitirá hacer su trabajo y cumplir con sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la refracción de su casa, que le permitirá seguir ofreciendo a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Ismael is a very hardworking man, who is always striving to keep working and getting ahead. His used the funds from his previous loan to purchase a new vehicle, which allows him to do his work and satisfy his customers. 

Ismael is applying for this loan to invest the funds in home repairs that will allow him to keep providing his family a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Gulbarkan

texts.ru: Гулбаркан 54 года, замужем, воспитывают 4 детей. Гулбаркан имеет среднее образование, работает почтальоном в местном почтамте. Супруг работает в районной электростанции - контролером. Гулбаркан по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулбаркан в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова 1 теленок, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,5 ГА, на котором выращивает хлопок. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Гулбаркан дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Гулбаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена произвести капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulbarkan is 54 years old, married, with four children. Gulbarkan has a secondary education and works as a mail carrier at the local post office. Her husband works at the local power station as an inspector. Gulbarkan is a calm, self-possessed and hard-working person by nature. Her husband and children help her in her business. As an additional source of income for her family, Gulbarkan has been raising livestock and growing produce for many years, having launched this business with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Gulbarkan’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow an done calf, and a 1.5-ha [about 4 acres] land plot, where Gulbarkan grows cotton. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Gulbarkan turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan intended to buy calves. Gulbarkan plans to invest the resulting revenue in a further expansion of her farm. Also, in the future, she plans to do major renovations on her house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline, habita en un barrio marginal de Managua en donde hay muchos conflictos vecinal y sobre todo delincuentes, ella es madre de dos hijos que son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria, Jaqueline labora vendiendo ropa, calzado, cosméticos por encargo, con sus ingresos y el apoyo de su esposo mantiene sus  gastos principales del hogar y la de sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar a hacer con esta primer etapa de crédito el muro frontal de su casa, esto para garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jaqueline lives in a marginal Managua neighborhood where there are many conflicts among neighbors and between all the criminal elements.  She is the mother of two children who attend middle and elementary school.  Jaqueline works selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to order and she and her husband pay the main household and childcare expenses.  She is asking for this loan to buy building materials to begin the first phase of building a wall in front of her house.  This will guarantee her children's safety.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes, caustic soda, oil, and wood for her businesses

loans.name: Rostand

texts.en:
Rostand is a 31-year-old single Cameroonian without a child. For the past year, he has sold used shoes in the market. Rostand’s business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

Rostand is requesting a loan to buy used shoes to resell. His loan will increase his profit by seventeen percent. Rostand hopes to also improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Doris' Group

texts.en:
Doris is in her late 40's and is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running a clothing and provisions business for 8 years. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. Doris is doing great with her business and family.

This will be her sixth loan request from ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Doris used the funds to buy clothing and provisions. She is happy with ID-Ghana products because they are so convenient. With this loan, Doris will buy more clothing and provisions. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. 

Doris will take this loan with her loan group, members totaling 5. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of 4,900 GHS.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rubber cups, buckets and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, 48 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. Leticia has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost three years, earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily which she spends on school allowances for their children. 

Due to lack of capital Leticia is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase noodles, canned goods, beverages, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. She hopes that her request will be granted so that her store can be improved.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods, beverages, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy education equipment.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали работает фермером. Ему 64 года. Он живет в городе Куляб с женой, тремя сыновьями и невесткой. Сафарали занимается растениеводством в течение 10 лет. Он научился выращивать сельскохозяйственную культуру у своего соседа, у которого есть дехканское хозяйство. Сафарали нравится его работа. Он обеспечивает свою семью не только доходом, но и свежими и экологически чистыми овощами. Ему в посеве и сборе урожая помогают сын и жена. Сафарали в данный момент проводит озимый посев. Он берет кредит для купли семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarali is a farmer. He is 64 years old. He lives in the city of Kulob with his wife, three sons and daughter. Safarali has worked in agriculture for ten years. He learned how to grow crops from his neighbor who has a private farm. Safarali loves his job. Not only does it provide the family's income, but also fresh organic vegetables. His son and wife help him sow and harvest. Safarali is currently sowing a winter crop. He is taking out a loan to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy a new computer.

loans.name: G/s La Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario la Paz está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, a muy temprana edad decidieron trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad siguen luchando para brindarles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Sonia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa, cosméticos, y útiles escolares como: pantalones, short, faldas, camisas, rubor, crema hidratantes, perfumes, cuadernos, lápices, corrector, resaltador. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de cosméticos, ropa y útiles escolares, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario La Paz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The La Paz Group is formed by three members, single mothers with seven children under their care. They are originally from Jinotepe, a place that is located in the northern part of Nicaragua. The women are known for being hardworking, responsible, and with strong desires to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, the women could not study, and at a very early age, decided to work to help with the expenses of the household. They are still struggling to provide their children with better opportunities. 

Because of her effort and desire to succeed, Sonia is the coordinator of the group. Her business is the sale of clothes, cosmetics, blush, moisturizers, perfumes, and school supplies such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, notebooks, pencils, white-out, and highlighters. She runs her business 8 hours a day selling products, and it is located in her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock the business with cosmetic products, clothes, and school supplies, so that Sonia can earn better income in the near future. The La Paz Group is grateful for the help that Kiva's investors offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, in order to for them to have a decent means of work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock the business with products such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, blush, lotions, perfumes, notebooks, pencils, white-out, and highlighters.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman with five children from Loon, Bohol. For the past ten years, she has raised hogs.

Belen is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and supplements to keep her pigs healthy. She will use her loan to improve her business, provide feed for her hogs, and boost their growth. Belen will use the profit from her loan for food, to pay household bills, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the construction of a greenhouse; the purchase of heaters and temperature and humidity gauges, plastic bins and containers; make improvements to his farm building; and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in weaving baskets for 16 years now to provide for her family. This is her main source of income. 

Gina is requesting a loan to buy materials such as "nito" (a native palm) for making baskets and to pay for transportation expenses. Her loan will help sustain her business and allow her to deliver on time. Gina will use the profit from her loan to provide food for her family and reinvest in her business. In the future, she hopes to expand and venture into other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy nito and pay for transportation

loans.name: Junkgirls, Llc Group

texts.en:
The Junk Girls was founded in 2009 and born out of a combination of Art Therapy for Jenny and Melissa’s love for all things handmade. After our 18+ years working in corporate that include Netflix and eBay, our vision is to put our collective skill sets together and do something meaningful that would make a difference for both us and others. We believe that everything has value, no matter how damaged it is, and we enjoy giving new life to things that might otherwise be overlooked or thrown away, which, as a metaphor, fits our lives perfectly. 

We are Social Entrepreneurs that work within the emerging new industrial revolution of Makers/Do It Yourself Micro-Manufacturing. Considered innovators by many, we are utilizing our background in art & design to create inventive ways to repurpose what some call junk into beautiful art, jewelry and home décor products, while enabling ourselves and others to heal during and by this process. 

The manufacturing of our metal stamped products is done 100% by hand. This is our number one area of growth, with our retailers requesting higher product volume than we can supply. By automating the process we can build product at least 4-5 times faster to meet the market demand.  A KIVA loan will help us with the first round of tools used in building the metal stamping automation process.

loans.use: To purchase the first round of tools used in building the metal stamping automation process and producing to meet market demand.

loans.name: Mastonaoy

texts.ru: Мастонаой всегда старается для улучшения условия проживания. Она добрая и заботливая мать. Мастонаой имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Ее муж производит пластиковые окна и двери. Мастонаой всегда хотела иметь собственный бизнес и помочь мужу по обеспечению семьи. Узнав о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин была очень рада и участвовала в нем. Теперь она уверена в себе, что может организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет организовать бизнес полотенца, покрывала, одеяло и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара. Она будет торговать на местном рынке, и с бизнесом будет справляться сама. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mastonaoy is always trying to improve her living conditions. She is a kind and caring mother. Mastonaoy has three minor children. Her husband makes plastic windows and doors. Mastonaoy has always wanted to own her own business and help her husband feed the family. When she learned about the entrepreneurial course "Bring It," organized by the Association of Business Women, she was very happy and participated in it. Now she is confident that she can start her own business. She wants to start a business selling towels, bedspreads, blankets, etc. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy goods. She will trade at the local market and will take care of the business by herself. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy goods to start a new business

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо жизнерадостный и добродушный мужчина. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, Муртазо пытается как-то зарабатывать деньги. В свободное время Муртазо работает таксистом, у него есть собственная машина для этого. От этой работы он получает хороший доход. Но как основным бизнесом, Муртазо занимается животноводством. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Муртазо хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Муртазо обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Муртазо заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Murtazo is a cheerful and good-natured man. He is married and has three children. He has a very close-knit family. They live in the countryside. Murtazo is trying to somehow make money so his family can have an income. In his spare time, he works as a taxi driver. Murtazo uses his own car for this. He earns a decent income from driving. But his primary source of income is animal husbandry. He breeds and sells livestock. In this case, he helps his wife. She cares for the cattle and also sells milk. Murtazo's livestock business brings in a good and stable income, so he wants to expand the business. He needs to buy a few head of cattle for breeding and resale. Murtazo approached Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring in more money, to better meet his family's financial needs. Murtazo thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges, bananas, and other fruit for her business

loans.name: Didie

texts.en:
Didie is a 41-year-old Cameroonian who is married with six children. Her oldest child is 19 and in secondary school and her youngest is seven and in primary school. For the past year, Didie has run a general store which has given her experience. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.

Didie is requesting a loan to buy stuff such as biscuits, powdered soup, rice, bread, bananas, and other items. Her loan will increase her profit by thirty percent and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stuff such as biscuits, powdered soup, rice, bread, bananas, and other items

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 49 years old, lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children. One is married, two are garment workers and another one works for a company that produces drinking water. 

Yon is a farmer. She grows rice on her farmland of 0.80 hectar. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and to pay for plowing fees. 

Yon is pictured at home, not at her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Vanry

texts.en: Vanry (pictured here) is 39 years old. She lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh City. She has two children who are in school. Her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities. Vanry is a cleaner for a school. She needs money pay for her house building fees because she has successfully built her house, but she has not paid for it yet. So, she asks for the loan to pay for building fees.

loans.use: to pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha lives in a village near the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She and her husband are rice and vegetable farmers. Kanha’s husband has a motorized hand-tiller which he rents out to his neighbors to plow farmland or move things or goods and he gets paid with fees. 

Kanha now has two sons. One is in school and the other one is a baby because she has just given a birth to a baby son (he is not in the photo with her).  

Kanha wants to raise a cow, so that she can earn extra income from selling a calf, when the cow delivers a baby, or for beef, when the cow is fully-grown.  Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Bazarsad

texts.en:
Bazarsad, 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as driver at a private firm since 2004. His wife has a position in the nursery at the surgery department of the hospital. Their elder son is graduating from university this summer and is  studying technology. The younger son goes to high school. 

Bazarsad is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to pay for his son's university tuition fee. He thinks this is the best investment he can make for his son because after graduating his university, his son can open opportunities for himself.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen, 29 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She manages a livestock business, raising some hogs. She has been in this business for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 per hog. Her profits from this business are usually spent on her farming business for additional income. Because of this, she would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase three bags of  hog feeds for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she can expand her business for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of  hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1981 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Каромат обратилась за займом, так как она собирается организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она планирует шить кроме женской одежды, занавески. Она планирует в будущем открыть свой цех. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила много новой информации для себя. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Karomat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1981. She is married and has four children. Karomat  is asking for a loan to start a business sewing women's clothes. She plans to sew women's clothing and curtains. She plans to open a shop in the future. She participated in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women, and she learned a lot of new information. She is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Jorge Jaime

texts.es:
La vida como joven emprendedor comienza desde que termino el bachillerato, desde hay empezó a tratar de buscar nuevas oportunidades de estudios y trabajo, pues es de un pueblo muy pequeño y humilde, se vino hasta la capital en busca de mejores oportunidades de estudio, porque las meta es ser un profesional y sabe que lo va a lograr.
Se ve en un futuro como un gran mecánico para que así todos los familiares se sientan orgullosos del buen mecánico automotriz que pueda llegar a ser, se entero de esta gran  oportunidad que le esta dando campo alto en convenio con kiva de estudiar con una gran facilidad de pago ya que no cuenta con la facilidad de pagar un semestre en una gran universidad. 
El convenio kiva me es de mucha ayuda porque el descuento le va ser de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The borrower's life as a young entrepreneur started when he finished high school. After that, he started to look for new opportunities to work and study. He came to the capital seeking better opportunities for education, since he comes from a very small and humble village. His goal is to be a professional and he knows that he will achieve his goal. In the future, he sees himself working as a great mechanic. In this way, all of his relatives will feel proud of what a good automotive mechanic he is able to be.

He came across this great opportunity being provided by Campo Alto and Kiva, which will let him pay for his studies easily. It isn't easy for him to pay for a semester at a big university otherwise. This agreement with Kiva will be a great help because the discount will be very helpful.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар добрая женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Муяссар и ее семья живут бедно, так как ее муж фермер и имеет маленький доход. Муяссар все эти годы помогала своему мужу. Теперь она хочет организовать свой собственный бизнес. Она планирует организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она умеет шить одежды. Муяссар участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muyassar is a good woman. She is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. Her children are minors. Muyassar and her family live in poverty, since her husband is a farmer and makes very little money. Muyassar has been helping her husband for years. Now she wants to start her own business. She plans to start a business sewing women's clothes since she knows how to sew clothes. Muyassar participated in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Izatulo

texts.ru: Изатуло 52 года. Он в данный момент работает наемным рабочим, но хочет открыть свой бизнес. Тот заработок, который он зарабатывает сейчас не хватает на семейные расходы и он решил начать прибыльный животноводческий бизнес. Изатулло проживает в городе Вахдат. При дворе его дома имеется коровник размером 6х4 метров, а также корм для скота. Его начальный капитал составляет 500 долларов США и еще он просит кредит в размере 1900 долларов. На эти деньги он планирует купить трех голов молодых бычков. Изатуло уже верит в успех бизнеса. У него имеется опыт в выращивании скота и теперь он намерен использовать этот опыт в новом бизнесе. За счет прибыли Изатуло хочет улучшить условия быта.
texts.en: Izatulo is 52 years old. He is currently working as a day laborer but wants to start his own business. His current income is not enough for the family's expenses, so he decided to start a profitable livestock business. Izatullo lives in Vahdat. In his yard, he has a 6 meter x 4 meter barn and cattle feed. He has $500 of startup money, and is requesting a loan of $ 1,900. With this money, he plans to buy three young bulls. Izatulo already believes in the success of the business. He has experience in raising cattle, and now he intends to use this experience in the new business. Izatulo wants to use the money he makes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy three young bulls to start a livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 37 years old and married, from Tagbilaran City, Bohol.  She has two school-aged children. 

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling chips, candies, snacks, cooking oil, electronic loads, and seasonings. Beatriz also sell shorts and shirts in the neighborhood. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more inventory for her store, like soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, eggs, shirts, and shorts.  

Beatriz would like to expand her business to save for her children's education and maximize profit.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soy sauce, eggs, canned goods, shorts, and shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new merchandise in bulk (glasses, accessories, watches, and bracelets, among other items).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This young and cheerful lady named Mariam is 24 years old and lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and has a new born son. She has a higher education and a specialty of translator, but she does not work now. Her husband works at the business center as a manager. Despite being young and unskilled they are both engaged in farming. In their farm they have cows, piglets and sheep. They also cultivate potato which they sell by the help of resellers. 
This young couple greatly wants to become engaged in swine breeding. For this occupation Mariam asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy piglets.

loans.use: to buy piglets in order to become engaged in swine breeding and to make a good profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used shoes and clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Ahla Joma`a Group

texts.en: Ahla Joma`a is a group of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. Eyman, who is 28 years old, is the leader of the group. She is a resourceful and honest woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Sana`a. She is a house wife whose main hardship is the lack of money. She said that her husband's income is not enough to cover household expenses. Eyman's family is currently in need of a new refrigerator, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni rial (YER) to buy refrigerator for personal use. She hopes that she will be able to improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for personal use.

loans.name: Laura Betzabe

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita Laura, tiene 26 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. 
Ella es una joven mujer para generar sus propios ingresos y con esto  poder salir adelante y también ayudar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, productos de catalogo o cualquier cosa que este de temporada, a ella le encanta el comercio y es como se gana la vida, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días a la hora que sea ya que no tiene horario fijo, ya son varios años que tiene su negocio por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito es para  comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo empezar su negocio. Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The April 20 Credit Group meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture, as well as for its handicrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous Panama hats. 

This is where Laura lives. She is 26 years old, and she lives with her parents. Laura is a young woman who wants to generate her own income so that she can get ahead, as well as help her parents who are of limited resources. She is involved in retail, and she sells clothes of all types: shoes, products from catalogs or whatever is in season. Laura loves doing business, and its how she earns her living. She sells her products door-to-door, and she goes out almost every day. Even though Laura does not have a fixed schedule, her business is already a few years old, and she has very good clientele. 

This loan is for buying clothes and shoes. Laura has been with the group since the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with these loans. Her dream is to have a great store.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Soban

texts.en:
Soban (in the photo), age 41, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She is a widow with three children, two sons and one daughter. One of her children is married, another one attends school and the other is still young. Soban also has an elderly mother, who is living with her.

Soban is a garment worker. She does not have her own transportation to get work, and she very often spends lots of money on traveling costs. Facing this, she decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina marcela una mujer de 18 años de edad que vive cada segundo de la vida, todos la conocen por la sonrisa que la caracteriza al igual que la preguntadera porque todo lo quiere saber pero muy poco responder. Una persona que detalla la vida y aprende de ella, pues la vida le enseño a que el pasado lo ayuda a no cometer los mismos errores o mejorar cosas en el presente; claro está que de los errores se aprende y hay que caer para poderse levantar aun con mas fuerzas.
Esta mujer tiene varias aspiraciones para la vida y tiene como proyecto de vida ser una profesional en la carrera  pero sobre todo como persona, que quiere sobresalir por los conocimientos ante los demás, hacer sentir orgullosa a la madre quien además de darle la vida es una mujer de admirar, la cual le ha enseñado a las hijas el verdadero significado de la unión familiar y de superar los obstáculos siempre teniendo aspiraciones, sueños, metas, de jamás dejar de estudiar de llenarse de conocimiento de experiencias vividas, conocer el mundo conocer a las personas y aprender de ellas.
Lina es una niña alegre, responsable, sencilla de pensamiento abierto, hiperactiva, ágil, jamás se queda quieta siempre da más de lo que le piden, solo pide una oportunidad más para seguir estudiando y seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
 Gracias a este convenio con kiva  puede estar cada vez más cerca del  sueño a cumplir lo que más anhela en esta vida que es ser una gran profesional, pero sobre todo poner en práctica todo lo que ha aprendido, porque cada día se aprende algo nuevo para poder crecer como persona.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela is an 18 year old woman who lives every second of her life. Everyone knows her for her smile and also that she is a questioner as she wants to know everything, but gets few answers. She is a person who itemizes life and learns from it, as life teaches that one learns from the past so as not to commit the same errors and improves the present. One learns from errors and one falls and gets up stronger.

Lina has a number of hopes for her life. Her main gal is to become a professional in a career but more so as a person. To standout for her knowledge compared to others. To make her mother proud. Her mother who gave her life is a woman to be admired who taught her children the real meaning of family unity and how to overcome obstacles with hopes, dreams and goals. To never stop learning, to fill oneself with life experiences, get to know the world and it's people and learn from them. 

Lina is a happy, responsible, simple, open-minded, active, open youth who never remains quiet no matter what other people say. She only wants another chance to continue to study and grow professionally and personally. Thanks to this loan from Kiva she can get ever closer to her dream i life which is to be a great professional and put into practice what she has learned. Every day she learns something new to help her grow.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores patos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace más de diez años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 63 years old and lives with his children in the Oyotún district.  It is a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

He works raising and selling small animals like hens and chicks, a business that he has had for over ten years.  His business is located in the rear of his home.  He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals, which will allow him to increase his earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara has been trading in cosmetics for two years already. She purchases cosmetics and other beauty care products from nearby markets and resells them to her customers. Due to the fact that she is very kind and hardworking, Klara has gained a good client base that prefers to order cosmetics and perfumes only from Klara. She lives with her father and 7-year-old child. Her father is a teacher, but the main income of the family comes from Klaras’ retail business.
To be able to increase the turnover and complete more orders, Klara has applied to SEF for financial support. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of cosmetics and perfumes to increase sales. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan will be a huge help for this hard working young woman to continue running her small business and ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is from Antequera, Bohol. For nine years now, she has been in the business of operating a sari-sari (general) store.  She sells items such as noodles, soft drinks, detergent, canned goods and eggs. Leonarda is applying for a loan to buy additional stock of goods like canned food, rice, noodles, snacks, beverages, detergents and toiletries. With her loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, thus improving her sales and income. In the future, Leonarda hopes to expand her business and make the most out of her profits.

loans.use: to buy canned food, rice, noodles, snacks, beverages, detergents and toiletries

loans.name: María Olivia

texts.es:
María, una madre y esposa ejemplar, reconocida en el pueblo por su carisma y don de gente, tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició hace aproximadamente 7 años, en compañía de su esposo, la idea surgió por la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar, pues sus 3 hijos están en edad escolar y demandan mucho dinero para educación, se había radicado en la ciudad pero por cuestiones familiares, decidió retornar al pueblo con su familia, para estar pendiente de sus padres que vivían solos.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (lácteos, carnes frías, cervezas, gaseosas, licor, entre otros), con la idea de satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año, dando como resultados un mayor nivel de ingresos para su familia.
María sueña con fortalecer y acreditar aún más su negocio, para que tenga permanencia en el tiempo y le garantice una rentabilidad estable para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación escolar y universitaria y disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
María is an exemplary wife and mother, renowned in the village for her charisma and sociability. She is 44 years old and earns a living by running her own business, a grocery store which she started approximately seven years ago with her husband. The business arose from the need to generate enough income to pay for household expenses, as their three children are school-aged and need a lot of money for education. María used to live in the city, but decided to return to the village to take care of her parents, who live alone. 

María would like to use the requested loan to purchase goods in bulk (dairy products, cold cuts, beers, soft drinks, and liquor, among other items) in order to meet the increased demand at the end of the year and increase income for her family. 

María dreams of strengthening and solidifying her business even more, so that it will last a long time and provide a stable income so that her children can have a better education, go to university, and enjoy a better quality of life with those that they love.

loans.use: to buy goods in bulk (dairy products, cold cuts, beers, soft drinks, and liquor, among others).

loans.name: Avetiq

texts.en:
Avetiq lives in Gyumri with his son and wife. He drives a taxi, using his own car. The taxi service is the family's main income, so Avetiq works day and night to meet his family’s needs. Because of financial hardships that the family currently faces, Avetiq isn’t able to make repairs and upgrades to this old car.
 
This loan will greatly assist Avetiq to purchase 4 tires for the winter season. Avetiq has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Avetiq will be very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to purchase 4 tires for the winter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Doa`a

texts.en:
Doa`a, 25 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. Doa`a is a friendly, hardworking, and honorable person. She is employed at a publicity agency, earning a low monthly income. Doa`a has been spending her savings income for household expenses and now she does not have any savings.

Doa`a has a small house and intends to complete purchasing home improvements. This is of great importance to her family as they will be able to live in better conditions. Doa`a is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances for her house. She is grateful to the people who help with credit and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Chanbot

texts.en:
Chanbot (in the photo), age 20, is single. He lives with his parents on an island of the Mekong River. His father is a policeman, and his mother is a weaver.

Chanbot is a second-year student, majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in Phnom Penh City. He will graduate in 2016. In the future, he hopes to have a good job and earn a salary of about $250 a month. He has decided to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Rudy Jr.

texts.en: Rudy operates his motorcycle transport service within his community. He is 25 years old and single. Rudy aims to earn more income in order to support his parents and to save some for his future. To continuously use his motorcycle, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy gasoline, sprockets and other accessories and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He is hoping that, someday, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, sprockets and other accessories and spare parts for maintaining his motorcycle.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 31, married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She's been in the hog raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. Her profits from her business are usually spent on the school allowances of her two children. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She hopes that with the help of the generous lenders she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Buenos Amigos.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Narcisa es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, carteras, zapatos y varios artículos más, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque que la mayoría de sus ventas son por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio con el cual se gana algo por su cuenta para el bien de su familia
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, zapatos, entre otras cosas que vende. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The “Buenos amigos” communal bank meets every fortnight in the Colegio Uruguay neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, It is also known as the City of Royal Tamarinds, a beautiful and hospitable city. 

Narcisa lives here. She is 54 years old, married and has four adult children from this relationship. Two of them still live at home. Her husband is a taxi-driver. Narcisa is a fighter who always has liked to work to get ahead together with her family. She sells clothing of all kinds, wallets, shoes and various other items. She sells door-to-door although the majority of her sales are by requests made by her clients. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. This is how she earns some money for herself and the benefit of her family. 

This loan will be used to purchase clothing, jewelry, shoes etc, for her to sell. This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it for the support of the loans. She dreams of having good health more than everything else.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona, 33 years of age, is married to a truck driver and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost six years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500-700 daily. Her net daily profit was spent on purchasing hogs to raise, and hog feed, for additional income. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Brayan Alexis

texts.es:
El es  brayan alexis nació el 28 de febrero en la ciudad de Bogota, a la edad de los 5 años ingreso a la institución educativa de fe y alegría en la cual hizo todos los estudios y en el cual pudo graduarse  con honores el 07 de diciembre del año 2013 y este se convirtió en el momento mas significativo para la vida y para la de toda la familia, a el le aficionan muchas cosas como el deporte y es un gran competidor.
Para la vida los momentos mas gratificantes y significativos fueron el obtener el diploma de bachiller,  ya que con el cual puede hacer una de las cosas que mas le apasionan.
Pero para esta persona también han existido momentos familiares muy duros como la muerte del abuelo y del  primo lo cual le afecto mucho,  pero el es una persona muy fuerte y a superado y afrontado estas situaciones difíciles.
Como persona es muy gentil un poco tímido y le gusta esmerarse por todas esas cosas que le apasionan y le ayudaran como herramienta para seguir adelante.
Brayan necesita el convenio con kiva  por que el y la familia no están pasando por un buen momento económico y este convenio seria de buena ayuda para que el pueda estudiar la carrera que tanto desea.
El escogió esta carrera por que le a apasionado ser un buen odontología y así poder tener metas claras en la vida.
texts.en:
Brayan Alexis was born February 28 in the city for Bogotá. At age five, he enrolled in the school of faith and joy, in which he completed all of his studies, and graduated with honors on December 7, 2013. This became the most significant moment in his life and that of his whole family's. Brayan is interested in many things, namely sports, and he is a great competitor. 

The most rewarding and meaningful thing in his life was getting his high school diploma, with which he will be able to do one of the things he is most inspired by. But for Bryan, there have also been hard times among his family, such as the death of his grandfather and his cousin, which affected him a lot. Yet he is a very strong person, and Brayan has overcome and confronted these difficult situations. 

Brayan is very kind, a little shy, and he likes to strive for all of the things that inspire him and will help him as tools to get ahead. He needs the agreement with Kiva because he and his family are not in good economic standing, and this deal would be a great help for him to be able to study the career he wants so much. Brayan chose this career because he is inspired to be a good dentist, and in this way be able to have clear goals in life.

loans.use: pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Due to hardships, Zenaida helps her husband generate income by planting vegetables in their backyard and selling them in the market. She aims to earn more income to satisfy her family's necessities. 

Zenaida plans to plant more kinds of vegetables but she doesn't have enough capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy seeds, herbicides and fertilizer needed for vegetable production. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will increase her production.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides and fertilizer needed for vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: Mrs. Purevjav, 60 years old, lives with her daughter and granddaughter in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her daughter runs a barbershop and her son-in-law works in Korea on a labor contract. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy a sofa and cabinets for their living room. By doing so, she will increase the comfort of living in her house.

loans.use: to buy a sofa and cabinets

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Due to insufficient income, Annabelle aims to improve her small variety store. She is 35 years old and has one child. Annabelle plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has limited capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of junk food, assorted candies, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her store. Annabelle is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of junk food, assorted candies, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jeff Anderson

texts.es:
Hola el es Jeff Anderson, no les contare la historia de la vida de el,  pero brevemente les contare porque la meta es ser el mejor diseñador gráfico y mejor publicista.
Desde pequeño el  hobby ha sido dibujar y crear cosas que vengan de la imaginación, ser muy atento a las cosas y muy servicial y colaborador. Entro a las mercedes a estudiar Arte Gráfico Y Publicitario porque quiere en un futuro ser un diseñador gráfico reconocido por hacer bien los trabajos y tener felices a los clientes con lo que realizo.
Es  responsable y le a agrada hacer los trabajos, le encanta diseñar y crear cosas innovadoras y que llamen la atención de las personas de manera positiva y darles a entender que la creatividad y la imaginación no tienen límites y que se pude llegar a ser grande si solo se imagina y se hace un mundo diferente lleno de cosas gratificantes y tolerantes para los demás. 
En el transcurso de la carrera ha aprendido lo necesario para saber que diseño le puede gustar a cada persona según los gustos y las prioridades, así como la creación de logos para algunos negocios y  locales como para equipos deportivos.
Si Kiva le ayudara con este convenio será gratificante ya que puede costearse los transportes, trabajos  y alimentación mientras esté estudiando ya que por el momento se encuentro desempleado y se le dificulta poder pagar el costo total del estudio, por tal motivo agradece  a kiva si lo apoya con este convenio para llegar a ser un buen diseñador gráfico y buen publicista y no quedarse atrás por no tener la oportunidad  de estudiar por no poder tener los recursos necesarios para pagar esta carrera.
texts.en:
Hello, he is Jeff Anderson.  I will not tell you his life story, but I will briefly tell you why his goal is to be a better graphic designer and advertiser.  From a young age, his hobbies have been drawing and creating things from his imagination.  He is very attentive, helpful, and collaborative.  He enrolled in Las Mercedes to study graphic arts and advertising because in the future, he wants to be a graphic designer who is known for doing good work and making his clients happy with his products.  

He is very responsible and he enjoys working.  He loves designing and creating innovative things that call people's attention in a positive way.  He wants to teach them that there are no limits to creativity and imagination, that one can achieve great things through imagination, and fill the world with gratifying and tolerable things for everyone else.  In his studies, he has learned enough to know what designs will appeal to different people given their tastes and needs, whether is is creating logos for businesses or sports teams.  

If Kiva can help him with this loan, it would be great as it would allow him to afford transportation, jobs and food while he is studying because at the moment, he is unemployed and is having trouble paying for school.  For this reason, he will be grateful to Kiva if they can help him so that he can become a good graphic designer and advertiser, and not stay behind in life because of his lack of education since he did not have the resources to pay for school.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Geoconda De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Buenos Amigos.
En este lugar vive la señora Geoconda, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años que estudia en escuela. Ella vive en casa de los padres. 
Doña Geoconda para salir adelante sola y para que no le falte nada a su hijo se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos por catálogo y productos Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha las mañanas que su hijo está en la escuela para realizar sus recorridos ya que en la tarde tiene que ayudarlo en sus clases y estar al tanto de su cuidado. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedican a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su hijo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, zapatos, perfumes y cosméticos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y seguros. Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the area of the College of Uruguay, in the city of Portoviejo, also known as "La Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos", a beautiful and hospitable city, the members of the Buenos Amigos lending group meet every 15 days.  Geoconda lives here.  She is 39 years old and is a single mother of a 12-year old son who is in school.  She lives in her parents' home.  In order to get ahead and provide for her son, she sells clothing and shoes through catalogs as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She sells her products door-to-door.  She takes advantage of the mornings when her son is in school to make her sales, because in the afternoons, she has to help him with his homework and take care of him.

She has worked in this field for over 12 years, which has helped her to get her son ahead.  This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise like clothing, shoes, perfumes and cosmetics.  She has been in the lending group since it began, and she enjoys it because the loans are quick and safe.  Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители бедные люди, поэтому она хочет организовать свой бизнес и помочь родителям по обеспечению семьи. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи. Она с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она нуждается в деньгах. Шохсанам запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shohsanam is a young and cheerful woman of 19. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents are poor and therefore she wants to start her own business offering sewing services and help them take care of the family. With this goal in mind she took part in the course "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she needs money. Shohsanam is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her own business

loans.name: Thi Bong's Group

texts.en:
Bong is 32 years old. She has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is a carpenter with a monthly income of VND 6,000,000. Bong is a tailor. Each month, she earns VND 4,000,000. In her spare time, Bong also raises chicken and plants vegetables to have more income and also reduce the amount of money they spend on food. Her family’s monthly income is about VND 10,000,000. As a hardworking and ambitious person, Bong wishes that one day she will have her own merchandise brand and a clothing factory. However, a capital shortage is currently her main problem. In addition, her shop is situated in inconvenient location which makes it difficult for Bong to promote and develop her business.
This is the second time Bong has participated in SEDA’s credit program. She has been SEDA’s customer since 2012. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 7,392,000 to buy fabric for her tailoring shop. Hopefully, the profit which is raised from sewing and selling cloths will help Bong launch her own clothing factory and improve her family’s living condition.
Other members who are part of Bong’s group are:
• Them is a mother of two children. She was born in 1978. Them is a butcher. She would love to borrow VND 6,944,000 to invest in her business.
• Chat was born in 1972. She has two children. She is a worker. In her spare time, she also feeds chicken to raise more income. Chat would like to borrow VND 6,944,000 to refurbish her house.
• Thoa was born in 1980. Similar to Them, Thoa wants to borrow VND 6,944,000 to invest in her family business which is a butcher shop.
• Thu was born in 1961. She has only one child. She wants to borrow VND 6,944,000 to invest in her business which is selling bamboo shoots and Vietnamese noodles.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 31 years old and he lives with his parents in Vanadzor, in the Lori region. Davit’s last loan on Kiva was used to convert his vehicle engine to work on CNG (compressed natural gas). CNG is cheaper and he thanks Kiva lenders very much since it helped him to save a lot of money while driving his taxi. Today he still drives the same taxi and his regular customers have increased. He says the income from his taxi service is enough to provide a living for their small family. The back door of his car has been damaged and he wants to repair it. The look of his car and safety of it worries Davit and his customers, who ride long distances with him, very much.
Davit is asking for a loan of 210.000 Armenian drams in order to repair his car’s back door.

loans.use: to repair his taxi's back door.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is smart young woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shoira is a third year student. She studies at Khujand State University. Shoira studies Eastern languages. She wants to be a translator after graduating university. Shoira studies well and is one of the best students. She must pay for her tuition but does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.ru: Махфуза молодая и энергичная женщина. Она родилась в 1992 году. Махфуза имеет грандиозную идею организовать собственный бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Махфуза участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mahfuza is a young and energetic woman who was born in 1992. She has great plans of starting her own business sewing women's clothing, a skill she learned from a dressmaker. Mahfuza participated in the course "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She doesn't have the money to buy a sewing machine. She is requesting a loan of 600 somoni to purchase one. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her own business

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik has been working as a designer for many years. Specifically she is engaged in designing banquet tables and houses for different ceremonies. Since Shushanik is a very attentive, careful and hardworking woman, her work is highly valued among the people in her town. Shushanik lives in Gyumri with her parents and brother. Her brother and father are seasonal migrant workers, so the family's main income comes from Shushanik’s hard work.

Shushanik has applied for this loan to be able to purchase needed supplies and materials for completing orders, The loan will be a huge support for her to satisfy the high demand during the coming holidays. Shushanik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Shushanik hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies and materials for providing a designer service

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Gyumri with his wife, mother and 5-year-old daughter. Garik drives a taxi and uses his own car. He is a very attentive and careful driver and has already gained a lot of loyal customers. Garik drives in Gyumri as well as, from time to time, long distances from Gyumri. The income from this activity is vital for the family's living so Garik works hard. He currently needs financial support to be able to invest in the car and improve the working condition. With the loan that he has applied for, Garik will be able to purchase new tires and repair the vehicle. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Garik will be very grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and repair the taxi.

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet lives in Gyumri with his wife and two small children.
Karapet is a shoemaker. He receives orders mainly from Vanadzor and makes different types of shoes.
Karapet makes good quality shoes and his customers are always very satisfied with his work.
Now, because of the coming holidays, Karapet has received a lot of orders. Unfortunately the materials that he has on hand, doesn't allow him to complete all the orders. So this hard working shoemaker asks your help. The loan that he has requested will greatly assist Karapet to purchase materials for sewing shoes. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Karapet and he waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Djumakan

texts.ru: Джумакан 63 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Джумакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Джумакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 700 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Джумакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Джумакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Джумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Djumakan is 63 and married with seven children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 700 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four milking cows on her farm, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Djumakan has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase cows to increase the head count of her herd. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing the number of cattle she has.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale, especially perfume.

loans.name: Lucelly Piedad

texts.es:
Lucelly, con 45 años de edad, es diseñadora de modas, lo que le permitió montar su propio taller de confección en el que produce bóxer para hombres, trabaja sola y tiene la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo, de esta forma logra generar recursos para el sustento de su familia. 
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros), lo que le permitirá tener disponibilidad de insumos para satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos y cumplir con los pedidos de manera oportuna. Esto le brindará la opción a Lucelly, de mejorar sus ventas y percibir mejores recursos para seguir luchando por el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es poder producir más diversidad de productos de marca propia para generar una mayor rentabilidad, en la misma medida que satisface las necesidades de sus compradores.
texts.en:
Lucelly is 45 years old and a fashion designer. She was able to set up her own workshop where she makes boxer shorts for men. She works alone and has the advantage of managing her own time. By this she is able to generate resources to support her family.

She wants to invest the loan she asks for in buying raw materials in bulk (fabric, thread, rubber bands, etc.), which will enable her to have available the supplies she needs to meet the current demand for her products and to fulfill orders in a timely manner. This gives Lucelly the option to improve her sales and get more funds to continue striving to fulfill her main dream: to make a greater diversity of own brand products and generate higher returns, and to the same extent to satisfy the needs of her buyers.

loans.use: to buy raw materialsin bulk (fabric, thread, rubber bands, and others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more potatoes and greens for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, 40 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 19 years, and in this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her daily profits are usually spent on purchasing hog feed for her hogs and the remainder goes on their food expenses.
