Due to lack of capital in her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase beverages, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gantomor

texts.en:
Mr. Gantomor is 46 years old and lives with his wife and one son in their small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. His wife Tsend-Ayush works at the local library as librarian. His son Horolgarav is a junior student at a university. 

Gantomor has been driving a car for years to earn a living and started his taxi service business in 2008. His wife provides taxi service in town during her free time as well in order to increase the family income and support their only child for better education and a brighter future. 

Gantomor is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNt to pay his son's spring semester tuition fee. The Gantomors' are hardworking and thoughtful people.

loans.use: to pay his son's spring semester tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and fruits and to replace her husband's car tires so he can continue to provide taxi service

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
This is Marife, 35, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rey, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating a business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marife owns and oversees operation of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity), which earns *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Marife dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, 48, is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow. She and her children manage their household while operating their business. Zenaida works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Zenaida operates a meat stall. She buys meat from suppliers who deliver the meat to different market stalls. Her products are pork, beef and processed meat products. Many patrons prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Zenaida's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Zenaida is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef needed in her business.

Zenaida hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is engaged in cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue within her community. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. To further improve her business, Mary Ann is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings needed to cook barbecue. She believes that her loan will help her improve the business.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings for cooking barbecue.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jorge  Oswaldo

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su  gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, el mismo que es muy alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio el joven Jorge él es soltero no tiene hijos vive con sus hermanos en la casa que recibieron por herencia de sus padres 
El joven Jorge tiene un negocio de internet en el cual trabaja un promedio de 9 horas diarias aprendió de esta actividad cuando empezó a trabajar en un local de los mismos en el sector, este préstamo lo invertirá en compra de activos y accesorios para computadoras y celulares para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo espera que su situación económica mejore mucho logrando atraer una mayor cantidad de cliente ya que mejorara ofrecer un excelente servicio, el joven Jorge agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a warm and humid climate, and kind and hardworking people.  The canton also has many tourist attractions.  Jorge is a very happy man who likes enjoying the organized festivities of the area like concerts and dances.  Jorge lives in this canton, is single and does not have children.  He lives with his siblings in the house that they inherited from their parents.  

Jorge has an internet business where he works about nine hours a day.  He learned this trade when he started working in a similar business.  He will use this loan to purchase parts and accessories for computers and cellphones in order to offer better service to his customers.  With this loan, he hopes to improve his financial situation by attracting more customers since he will be offering excellent service.  Jorge thanks the Fundación Altertnativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity they have provided.

loans.use: purchase parts and accessories for computers and cellphones.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo (pictured here) is a construction worker. He lives in a small village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has two children, one son and one daughter. One attends school and the other one is still young. 

Sambo wants raise cows so that he can earn extra income from selling the calves when the cow deliveries a calf or for beef when the cow is fully grown.  Hence he decided to apply for a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Alberto Rosalio

texts.es: Alberto de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto  a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 3 años, 8 años y 27 años de edad. Alberto trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Alberto desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para instalar el servicio de luz eléctrica en su vivienda. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así dar a su familia condiciones más cómodas.
texts.en: Alberto is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 8, and 27.  Alberto has worked s as a mason and earns a living and supports his household this way.  Alberto wants to improve his living conditions, so he is asking for a loan through FUSAI to install electricity in his home.  He hopes to have access to this financing so he can provide more comfortable conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Zarafshon

texts.en:
Zarafshon was born in 1985. She is married and has three children. Her children are little. She lives with her family in the north part of Tajikistan. She lives poorly because her husband is a farmer and makes a low income. 

Zarafshon is going to organize her own business with sewing national dresses. She will provide her service in her house. She took part in a course  named "To Get Ahead" from a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Alberto de 63 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 8 años, 17 años, 15 años y 6 años de edad. Alberto se dedica  a realizar trabajos de albañilería desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma mantiene la economía del hogar y lleva el sustento a su familia. Desea construir un muro de retención en su vivienda ya que el terreno es un poco inclinado y cuando llueve tiende a lavarse. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de piedras, arena, cemento, hierro, etc. y así poder proceder a la construcción del muro perimetral lo antes posible.
texts.en: Alberto is 63 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and children, ages 8, 17, 15, and 6.  Alberto has worked as a mason for a long time and supports his family in this way.  He wants to build a retention wall in his home because the land is sloped and it floods when it rains.  He is asking for this loan through FUSAI so he can buy stones, sand, cement, iron bars, etc. so he can begin building the wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Thi Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1961. She is the mother of three children. Two of them are earning an income now. Her oldest son works for the army. The second one is a teacher. And her youngest daughter is studying at a college. Her husband is a builder. His monthly income is VND 5,000,000. Besides feeding pigs, Bong trades recycled materials to raise more income. The total income of her family is VND 16,000,000 per month. As a hardworking person, Bong wishes that she had enough money to raise more pigs. She hopes that her business will continually develop and she will have the chance to obtain favorable relationships thus she could buy scrap metal directly from the factories.
This is the first time Loan has participated in SEDA’s credit program. She would love to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy fodder for her pigs.
Since Loan is a reliable person, she was voted to be the leader of the 6 member group. The other members who are part of Loan’s group are:
• Thuong is 53 years old. She is the mother of 4 children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to raise pigs and chickens.
• Tinh is also 53 years old. She has 3 children. She would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to feed chickens.
• Khoan is 47 years old. She has 2 children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to invest in her clothing shop.
• Luan is 24 years old. She has 2 children. She would love to borrow VND 5,152,000 to raise pigs.
• Dai is 38 years old. He is the father of 5 children. He wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to invest in his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fodder for pigs.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Mrs. Myagmar is 52 years old and lives with her brother in their small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her brother works at local blacksmith shop as a welder. 

Myagmar started her business in 2010 and has provided welcoming and friendly service to local clients ever since. She has up and downs in her business but now her business is stable and needs extra investment to expand her business a little bit. She is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell at her rental stall. She is hardworking, very responsible, and a friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell at her rental stall

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel has become the best client both for Kiva and for Nor Horizon. His last two Kiva loans were very productive and successful. He continues his farming and agricultural occupations. During his last two loans, Samvel lived in the village of Hovk in Tavush region (where he worked as a livestock expert), but now Samvel and his family have moved to Ijevan city, and he is once again engaged in farming. On his farm, he has 8 cows, a bull, 10 calves, 2 horses and 15 chickens. Samvel says that he mainly manages to sell dairy products and meat from his farm. Samvel, thanks to his farm’s income, takes care of his family perfectly. He bought furniture for his house and a car for his son. Samvel’s son also drives a truck that he uses to make private cargo deliveries and helps his father to earn their living.

Samvel is asking for a loan 800,000 Armenian drams to buy a cow and winter tires for their car.

loans.use: to buy a cow and winter tires for their car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Estrella Magdalena

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Buenos Amigos.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad y la menor tiene 17 años  la cual estudia en universidad y vive con ella, también con ella vive una nieta que es especial y está a su cuidado.
Doña Estrella es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para sacar adelante a sus hijos sola, ella  tiene un pequeño restaurante  en su casa, allí trabaja todas las mañanas y tardes ya que solo prepara almuerzos,  son muchas personas que asisten a su local a servirse sus deliciosos platos y esto es porque ella prepara sus platos de la manera más saludable y esto  les gusta a sus clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar carne, pescado, arroz y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Buenos Amigos lending group meets every 15 days in the Colegio Uruguay area of the city of Portoviejo, also known as "La Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, a beautiful and hospitable city.  Estrella lives in this city.  She is 52 years old and separated, but she has six children; five are adults and the youngest is 17 years old, is in college, and lives with her.  She also has a granddaughter who lives with her that has special needs and is in her care. 

Estrella is a woman who likes earning her own in order to pouch her children ahead.  She has a small restaurant in her home where she works every morning and afternoon preparing lunches.  Many people come to her restaurant to enjoy her delicious meals that she prepares in the healthiest way, which her customers really like.  This loan will be used to purchase meat, fish, rice and other foods to prepare meals.  She has been with the lending group for two years and she enjoys it because the loans allow her to get ahead.  Her dream is for her daughter to be a professional.

loans.use: purchase meat, fish, rice and other foods.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy greater quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of Ksh.10,000 to buy more stock of food ingredients such as wheat flour, onions, maize flour, tomatoes, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients such as wheat flour, onions, maize flour, tomatoes, rice and sugar to prepare cooked food.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
This is Jason, 37, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. His partner is Arleen, a worker abroad, and they have two children. He manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jason operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for access to computers, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. He rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. He will utilize the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in his business. 

Jason hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to give a good life to his family. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional computers, spare parts, and supplies

loans.name: Mairambu

texts.ru: Майрамбу 51год, замужем, воспитывает вместе с супругом 2 детей. Майрамбу имеет средне-специальное образование. Майрамбу по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Майрамбу в хозяйстве имеется: 1 лошадь и 30 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,54 ГА на котором выращивает клевер и сафлор. Ее деятельность приносит около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Майрамбу дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Майрамбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Mairambu is 51 and married with two children. She has a specialist high school education and is a calm, balanced and hardworking woman. Her husband and children help with her animal husbandry business, an enterprise she began many years ago with starting capital of 5,000 KGS and which is the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Mairambu's hard work, she now has one horse and 30 sheep, as well as a 3.54 hectare parcel of agricultural land on which she grows clover and safflower. Her business brings in about 11,000 KGS per month, which serves to cover her family's basic daily needs, including food. Income from the farm has allowed Mairambu to give her children a good education. With the goal of further developing her business, Mairambu has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase cows. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further improvement of her farm as well as putting money toward her son's future marriage.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer activa y emprendedora, a sus 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Es propietaria de una miscelánea desde hace algunos años, en la que ofrece productos de belleza, accesorios de bisutería, productos de aseo personal, entre otros, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda y, al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos, también puede estar pendiente del cuidado de su familia, especialmente de uno de sus hijos que presenta dificultades mentales, lo que se ha convertido en un gran desafío para ella; sin embargo, su perseverancia y paciencia le han permitido salir adelante.
Actualmente requiere generar más ingresos debido a que los gastos familiares se han incrementado y el salario que devenga su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades, por ello se motiva a solicitar el crédito para pagar un curso de capacitación en belleza, pues ve en este campo una posibilidad de negocios rentable que, además complementaría los servicios en su actual negocio, porque además de asesorar puede prestar el servicio de corte, cepillado, manicure y pedicure a los mismo clientes, obteniendo así un ingreso adicional.
Norma manifiesta que su objetivo principal es ampliar su negocio y consolidarlo en el mercado para que tenga permanencia en el tiempo y le genere mejor rentabilidad, para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Norma is an active and enterprising woman.  She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children whom she has gotten ahead with great effort and dedication.  She has had a general store for several years and offers beauty products, costume jewelry, toiletries, and other things.  Her business is located in her home and she generates income this way and can also care for her family, especially one of her children who has mental difficulties and he is a great challenge for her.  Never the less, her perseverance has allowed her to get ahead.

Now she needs to generate more income because her family expenses have increased and her husband’s salary is not enough to cover all the needs, so she is asking for a loan to pay for a beauty course because she sees the possibility of making money in this field.  She will also complement the services from her current business, because besides giving advice she can also do haircuts, combings, manicures, and pedicures for her customers so she can earn an extra income.

Norma says that her main goal is to grow her business and consolidate in the market so that it will become permanent and that it will generate more profit so she can provide a better quality of life and wellbeing for her children.

loans.use: to pay for a beauty course.

loans.name: Osbal Alcides

texts.es:
Osbal ha sido un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, se ha desempeñado como comerciante independiente, pues tenía un negocio de video juegos que funcionó durante varios años, pero hubo una época en la que las ventas disminuyeron a tal punto que tuvo que cerrarlo y buscar empleo, comenzó a trabajar como oficial de electricidad en una empresa y fue ahorrando hasta que hace aproximadamente 1 año pudo independizarse y montar su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, trabaja en la acera de su vivienda y ya ha logrado tener reconocimiento en el sector a pesar de tener tanta competencia directa.
La motivación para solicitar el crédito radica en el anhelo de fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio, pues con el dinero desea hacer mejoras locativas (pintar las paredes y poner techo en el espacio), comprar sillas, mesas y una nevera para almacenar los insumos; esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen al negocio, logrando atraer nuevos clientes para ofrecerles mejor comodidad y productos de calidad, mejorando notablemente las ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Osbal manifiesta que para un futuro a mediano plazo se proyecta teniendo un restaurante grande y reconocido en el sector, que le garantice una rentabilidad favorable para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Osbal is a hard-working and enterprising man who has been an independent business as he had run a video game business for several years. But at a point in time sales diminished to a point where he had to close the business and look for work. He started to work as an electrical official in a company and saved his money.

A year ago he was able to become independent again as he opened a fast food business. He works from the sidewalk by his house and has managed to become known in the field in spite of much direct competition.

What motivates him to request this loan is the desire to strengthen and solidify his business. He wants to make structural improvements (like paint the walls and roof-over the area) buy chairs, tables and a freezer to store his supplies. This will allow for a better image for his business, attracting new customers by offering them more comfort and quality products. And allow for greater sales and the revenue he obtains from his labor.

Osabl indicates that in the medium future he plans to own a large well known restaurant which would guarantee a favorable profit to provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to make improvements in his business (paint the walls and roof-in an area) buy chairs, tables and a freezer to store his supplies.

loans.name: Mukhrani

texts.en: Mukhrani is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Korbouli, Sachkhere district. He lives with his father, wife and two children. His family's primary source of income is Mukrani's work selling agricultural products at the local market, taking care of the cattle and using its products for trading and for his family's needs. His father helps him with this activity. Mukhrani's income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. He wants to improve his agriculture business and expand it. In order to develop his farm further, he requested a loan of 4,000 GEL to buy four cows. He will then sell milk products to a larger market. So Mukhrani has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start up Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Mukhrani and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain his agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José ha sido un trabajador apasionado por la mecánica automotriz, especialmente la de vehículos de carga pesada, razón por la que lleva aproximadamente 45 años desempeñándose en este campo de acción; inició trabajando en diferentes talleres durante 15 años y después de haber ahorrado lo suficiente, decidió emprender su propio taller de mecánica industrial, en el que actualmente genera dos empleos indirectos y además logra pagar su seguridad social, atiende a diferentes empresas de transporte y al público en general que llega a su taller.
La finalidad de la solicitud del crédito, es comprar repuestos y lubricantes al por mayor, para tener disponibilidad suficiente y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, lo que permitirá lograr una fidelización y mejorar los ingresos para solventar los gastos y necesidades de su esposa y sus dos hijos.
José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es lograr cerrar su ciclo productivo de una manera adecuada pues sueña con pensionarse no sin antes dejar su negocio bien establecido para que le permita garantizar una estabilidad económica y disfrutar de una vejez tranquila al lado de los que ama.
texts.en:
Jose works enthusiastically as an auto mechanic, specializing in heavy vehicles. He’s been doing this for 45 years. He began by working in different shops over 15 years. After he had saved enough money, he decided to open his own shop. He employs two employees indirectly and is also able to pay social security. His customers are transport companies and members of the general public who come to his shop. 

The purpose of the loan application is to buy parts and lubricants in bulk to have enough on hand to meet his clients’ needs. This will win him customer loyalty and increase his income so that he can pay bills and meet the needs of his wife and two children. 

Jose says that he wants to close out this loan cycle in a professional way since he wants to retire after having made his business well-established. This will guarantee him financial security and allow him to enjoy a peaceful retirement alongside those he loves.

loans.use: to buy parts and lubricants in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up the business with goods sold in bulk (snacks, cookies, beers, soft drinks, and liquor, among other items).

loans.name: Darío

texts.es:
Darío, es un padre y esposo ejemplar, que ha luchado arduamente por sacar adelante a su familia y darle educación a sus dos hijos. Desde hace 20 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ubicada cerca a una terminal de buses lo que se convierte en una ventaja para el negocio, además ya es reconocido y está posicionado en el sector, gracias a la trayectoria que tiene.
El crédito que solicita, desea invertirlo en el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues requiere comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, galletería, granos, mecato, gaseosas, carnes frías, dulces, entre otros), lo que le permitirá prepararse para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Darío, es un hombre soñador y su edad no le impide seguir luchando para lograr sus objetivos, en especial sueña con tener un minimercado bien surtido en el que los visitantes encuentren todo lo que requieran y así poder garantizar una rentabilidad favorable para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo, pueda disfrutar de una vejez tranquila y con un mejor bienestar al lado de su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dario is an exemplary father and husband. He works hard to get his family ahead and provide his children with an education. He’s had a grocery store for the past 20 years. It’s located in the bus station where he converted a ticket sales window into a store location. Thanks to his work history, he’s well known and respected in the area.

He’d like to use the loan he’s requested to strengthen his business. He needs to buy goods in bulk (dairy products, cookies, beans, snacks, cold cuts, candy, etc.). This will allow him to be prepared to meet the tastes and needs of his customers which will result in an increase in sales and income. 

Dario is a dreamer and his age doesn’t stop him from working towards his goals. He especially wants to have a well-stocked store where visitors find what they’re looking for. He also wants to guarantee good sales in the near future so that he can enjoy a peaceful retirement and a better quality of life for himself, his wife, and his children.

loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (dairy products, cookies, beans, snacks, soda, cold cuts, candy, etc.)

loans.name: Leonardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre trabajador, a sus 44 años de edad, trabaja en su propio negocio, una ebanistería que inició hace varios años con unos ahorros que había recolectado y, con la experiencia y el conocimiento que adquirió cuando trabajó como empleado en una empresa especializada en venta de maderas y fabricación de muebles. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en un local arrendado, pero además presta el servicio a domicilio, especialmente para decoración de apartamentos, de esta manera ha generado los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. 
El crédito desea invertirlo en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (madera, pinturas, entre otros), así podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes para esta temporada y podrá mejorar las ventas y sus finanzas personales.
Leonardo tiene como propósito principal, seguir trabajando para poder adquirir su local propio y montar su taller más amplio, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y así aumentar el nivel de producción, atrayendo más clientes; esto le dará la opción de mejorar su calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a hard-working man.  He is 44 years old, and he works in his own furniture making business.  He started the business several years ago with some savings that he had gathered together and with the experience and knowledge that he acquired when he worked as an employee for a business specializing in wood sales and furniture making.  The business is in a rented place.  He also provides home service, especially for decorating apartments.  This way he has generated the resources needed to support his family.

He wishes to use the loan to buy raw material wholesale (wood, paint, and others).  This way he will be able to fill the pending orders that he has this season.  He will be able to improve sales and his personal finances.

Leonardo’s main goal is to continue working in order to get his own place and set up a bigger shop.  This will allow him to generate employment opportunities, increase his level of production, and attract more customers.  This will give him the chance to improve his quality of life and the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material wholesale (wood, paint, and others).

loans.name: Badri

texts.en: Badri is a 25-year-old married man, who lives in Tunadzeebi, part of the Khulo district. He lives with his wife and 2 children. His family's primary source of income is Badri's work cultivating agricultural land and selling products to the local market, in particular potatoes, maize and nuts. His wife also helps him actively and takes care of their children. Badri's income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. He wants to improve his family's living condition. Badri's request has now been approved within the framework of Kiva and Credo and is able to use a startup loan to set up a general store located near his house. He needs 2000 GEL to purchase stock of merchandise such as groceries and household goods. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover their everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his newly opened general store.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 62-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is a widow with  six grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like biscuits, chips, canned goods, seasonings, soap and noodles. Her business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more grocery items and  soft drinks. This will help her maintain the inventory of her store as well as cater for the needs of her customers.

In the future, Jacinta hopes to expand her small business to be more productive.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and  soft drinks

loans.name: Buyandelger

texts.en: Mr. Buyandelger, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a monastery for 15 years; his main duty is to prepare ceremonies. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their daughters. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, and now it needs some renovation. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for his house renovation. As a result, his family can live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants released.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 33-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with two children aged nine and six. Her husband works as a driver to support their family. She operates a business selling electronic load to customers. She caters for load to Smart  and Talk 'n Text subscribers. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to have additional capital to purchase electronic load.  This is essential in making her business profitable.

In the future, Mary Joy  hopes to expand her business further to become more productive and at the same time support the education of her children.

loans.use: to have  additional capital to purchase electronic load

loans.name: Wilda

texts.en:
Wilda is a resident of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of 10 children. Having a big family is quite challenging specially when it comes to meeting the needs of her children. For quite some time now, she has been in the business of hog raising. Wilda is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs. 

With this loan, she will be able to buy an adequate supply of feed to fatten her hogs and additional piglets to raise. Her future profit will be used for school fees, healthy food for her family, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase more fish, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, cooking oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina, age 47, is a mother of eight children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important in order for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Rubina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. Rubina is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring products for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Thi Dinh Group

texts.en:
Dinh was born in 1975. She is a very hard working and active person. Dinh has three daughters. The youngest daughter is only 4 years old. One daughter is a worker and the other one studies in high school. Her husband is a carpenter with a monthly income of VND 6,000,000. Dinh earns a living as a farmer. Every month, from growing crops and vegetables, feeding poultry and pigs and babysitting children, Dinh makes 4,000,000 VND. Her family monthly income is about 12,000,000 VND. Dinh wishes that one day she may have a bigger house, be able to expand her family carpentry workshop and own a furniture shop. However, she is facing a shortage of funds for buying wood.  Thus, Dinh would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to fulfill this need. Profit from selling her husband’s product will be spent on improving Dinh’s family living condition, tuition fees for children, and upgrades to her carpentry workshop.
Dinh joined SEDA credit program in 2010; this is her fifth cycle loan. That makes her a great leader in a group of five members. The names of other members in Dinh’s group are included in the following list:
•	Nga was born in 1960. She has three children. She would like to borrow VND 10,080,000 to invest in her grocery shop.
•	Lac was born in 1979.She is the mother of two children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy wood for her family carpentry workshop.
•	Lan was born in 1984. She has three children. She would love to borrow VND 5,152,000 to raise pig.
•	Huong was born in 1977. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to raise pig.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.en: Rayhona is 19 years old. She is a hardworking woman. Rayhona is not married and lives with her parents. Rayhona had an agriculture business, but earned a low income. Now, she wants to organize a new business cooking and selling rolls, biscuits, etc. She took part in a course called “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy an oven. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her new business

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan is 51-years-old and a single woman. She currently lives with her sister and some nieces and nephews in a small village, where she operates a small grocery store and sells Khmer noodles with fish soup to earn a living. Through her efforts, she is able to make a suitable income of USD 5.00 per day.

As her house is under construction, Savan is asking for a loan in the sum of 1,000 US dollars to complete the unfinished parts of her house. This will be her fifth loan with HKL and the first loan with Kiva. She dreams of having a comfortable house, so she can help everyone in her family live in a safe way. Savan has never been late with any of her repayments back to the institution.

loans.use: to complete the unfinished parts of her house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be self motivated and innovative. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are retail customers. 

Esther describes her biggest business challenge to be poor climatic conditions. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm implements and farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful farmer. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy farm implements and farm inputs

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 19 years. He describes himself to be ambitious, visionary and focused. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell and also sells beverages. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with a huge population and his primary customers are local residents. 

Benjamin describes his biggest business challenge to be that it is difficult to estimate how much food will be used in a given day. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to open another restaurant. This loan will enable him buy stock of ingredients, hire a place, etc. to enable him to open another restaurant so that he can increase his income. His business goal is to open more branches within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will give his children high quality education. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to open another restaurant

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 36-year-old married woman from the municipality of Getafe in the province of Bohol. She has five children ages 6-17 years old. Eufemia owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various goods like shampoo, detergent, bath soap, seasonings, canned goods, noodles and chips. She has been in the retail business for three years. 

Eufemia requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, chips, cookies, canned goods, noodles, candies and biscuits to cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future, Eufemia would like to expand her business further  to improve her family's standard of living and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, cookies, canned goods, noodles, candies and biscuits

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business and he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are regular customers. 

Emmanuel describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best in the transport field within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en: Berlinda is 50 years old from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with one dependent, who is 16 years old. Her three other children are already on their own. She is engaged in raising hogs, producing copra, and weaving baskets. Berlinda is asking for a loan to buy feed, buri, and rattan so she can increase her production and increase profits for her business. She will use her loan to further expand her business, provide better meals for her family, and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy feed, buri, and rattan

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is an industrious man. He is 25 years old and married but has no children. He lives with his wife and mother. Two months ago, he began his own business selling food items. He sells his goods in a local market. This month he organized a party for his family. That’s how  he spent all of his saving. He has no money to buy food items to increase the working capital of his new business. Aziz is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy food items. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 44-year-old, married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has four children to support with his transportation business, using his tricycle. This business has been in existence for more than two years now. 

Felix is asking for a loan to buy nuts, bolts, tires, and gasoline. With this loan, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle, allowing him to make a good living and be more productive. 

In the future, Felix hopes of making his business a success. In addition to that, he would like to continue sending his children to school. His income provides food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy nuts, bolts, tires, and gasoline.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una mujer carismática y alegre, a sus 66 años de edad, maneja su propio negocio de venta de utensilios para la cocina y accesorios de bisutería, la experiencia la obtuvo trabajando durante 42 años en diferentes cacharrerías del centro de la ciudad, lo que la impulsó a montar su propio negocio hace 9 meses, para generar recursos para el sustento propio.
Nunca se casó y no tuvo hijos, sin embargo no se siente sola, pues manifiesta que su dinamismo y energía le han permitido salir adelante por cuenta propia.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (juego de vasos, vajilla, recipientes plásticos, entre otros); así podrá tener más variedad de artículos disponibles que satisfagan el gusto y los requerimientos de sus clientes, mejorando así el nivel de ventas e ingresos.
Carolina tiene como propósito, darle continuidad a su negocio para que siga siendo rentable y le permita disfrutar de una vejez más tranquila y con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carolina is 66 years old and a charismatic and cheerful woman. She runs her own business selling kitchen utensils and decorative items. She has gained experience working indifferent pottery shops in the city center for 42 years and this prompted her to set up her own business nine months ago, in order to generate the income to support herself.

She never married and has no children, nevertheless she does not feel lonely and she says that her dynamism and energy have enabled her to succeed on her own.

Currently she is asking for a loan to help her buy supplies in bulk (sets of glasses, dishes, plastic containers, and others) in order to have a greater variety of articles on stock to meet the demand of her customers. By this she will be able to raise her sales and her income.

Carolina aims to give continuity to her business so it can remain to be profitable. Thus she will be able to enjoy a quiet live and better living conditions in her old age.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk (sets of glasses, dishes, plastic containers, and others).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 37-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from two years to 15 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of products. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of groceries. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 30,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 33 years old, is married and has one child, 2 years old. He describes himself to be goal oriented. For the past 4 years, John has operated a retail business selling electronics and furniture. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. John describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. 

John will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy stocks of furniture and electronics for resale. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. John hopes that, in the future, he will succeed. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He repaid his previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully. John will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child and to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of furniture and electronics for resale

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik has been involved in cosmetics sales for about 2 years. She lives in Ijevan town with her husband and two children. Tatevik's husband is a taxi driver and works hard to be able to earn a good income for his family. In order to overcome financial hardships, Tatevik purchases cosmetics from a nearby town and sells them to her customers. Tatevik has a big number of customers who order cosmetics only from her, because she provides high quality service.

Now, Tatevik is requesting this loan to increase her turnover and cover her customers' demand. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist her in purchasing cosmetics to resell to customers. Tatevik will be very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to resell to customers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатиме 33 года. Совместно с супругом воспитывают четверых детей. В 2003 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания с арендованного магазина, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Фатима имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги увеличить товарооборот в магазине. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Фатима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - для оптовой покупки продовольственных товаров и прохладительных напитков для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Фатима планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение для своих детей в университете.
texts.en: Fatima is 33; she and her husband are raising four children. In 2003, the couple started a business selling groceries from a rented shop, using a sum of 10,000 KGS as starting capital. Through development of the business and building a steady client base, Fatima now has an average monthly income of 12,000 KGS. Thanks to their hard work with the business, the couple has increased turnover in the shop. With the goal of further building the business, Fatima has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase wholesale food products and soft drinks to be resold in her store. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing turnover and to save money toward her children's university education.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food store

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.ru: Каныгул 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Каныгул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Каныгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каныгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется:20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Каныгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Kanygul is 58 and married with seven children. She has a specialist high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 21 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kanygul now has 20 sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Kanygul has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase sheep to increase her quantity of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increase of her number of livestock, and to put money toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 43 years and lives in the village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region. Anahit lives with her daughter and her parents. Her parents are retired and her daughter is a student. Anahit has worked as an accountant for the last several years, and at the same time, with her parents, she is engaged in agriculture and farming. They have a rich orchard and they manage to sell the harvest (grapes, cornel and persimmons) at the local wholesale market. They also cultivate and sell wheat and corn. Anahit also manages to sell a lot of eggs. On her farm, she has 25 chickens. She says that thanks to her farm income, she manages to take care of her small family properly. She also pays her daughter’s tuition fee.

Anahit wants to repair their orchard’s fence and buy a pig (to try her luck at swine breeding), so she is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: to repair their orchard’s fence and buy a pig

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 60 years old, married, and has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a restaurant where he sells cooked food, which he has been doing for three years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road network. 

Charles is requesting his third loan from SMEP DTM for 40,000 KES, which he will use to buy ingredients for preparing food, such as cooking oil, maize, beans, and other items. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, maize, and beans for preparing food

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana, con 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo a quien ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación. Hace algunos años, trabaja en su propio negocio, una salsamentaría donde ofrece mecato, licor, gaseosas, cervezas y además presta el servicio de entretenimiento con máquinas traga monedas, el establecimiento funciona hasta la madrugada y es ella quien labora sola todos los días; así ha logrado brindarle educación a su hijo y solventar los gastos del hogar. 
El préstamo lo solicita como alternativa para mejorar su negocio, pues requiere adecuar el espacio para poner una bodega de almacenaje, comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato, dulces, entre otros) y pagar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá fortalecer su negocio y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, mejorando así las ventas y la entrada de dinero para el sustento familiar.
Ana manifiesta que su único interés es darle continuidad a su negocio y diversificar sus servicios, para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos. Esto es una opción para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo principal que es dar un mejor bienestar a su hijo para que sea un hombre de bien y se forje un futuro más exitoso.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and the single mother of a son for whom she’s gotten ahead with much effort and dedication. She’s worked in her own business for a few years. She runs a pork butcher’s shop where she sells lunch meats, liquor, soda, and beer. She also has slot machines for entertainment. Her business is opens at sunrise, and she works every day. This is how she’s been able to give her son an education and meet household costs.  

The loan she’s asking for is another way she can improve her business since she needs more space for a storage shed, to buy supplies in bulk (soda, beer, meats, candy, etc.), and to pay the balance of her current loan. This will allow her to strengthen her business and meet her customer’s needs, improving sales and income to support her family. 

Ana says that her one goal is to continue her business and diversify her services so that her customers are well served. This is a way to move forward and meet her objective of giving her son a good quality of life and securing a more successful future.

loans.use: to renovate her space to be able to have a storage shed, to buy supplies in bulk (soda, beer, cold cuts, candy, etc.), and to pay off her previous loan.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juditha dreams that her business will continue to exist and hopes for a good health for her whole family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana, age 39, is the mother of six children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the family's only source of income. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell but lacks the money to do so. This purchase will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. His wife, Shabana, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband.

He will use this loan to purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Shabana feels happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of embroidery material

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is a 47-year-old single man from the town of Cortes, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells various items ranging from beverages, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, powdered juice, to canned goods and soap. He started up his business three years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy  various  merchandise items and a sack of rice, to continue his livelihood activity.

In the future, Venerando hopes to expand his  business to become successful and set aside some of the profit  to help support  the schooling of his two young nephews.

loans.use: to buy  various stock and a sack of rice

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ready-to-wear clothing items, like shirts for men and women, to resell to customers. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing items, like shirts for men and women, to resell to customers. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Avelina hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear clothing items, like shirts for men and women, to resell to customers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Lilia dreams that her business will flourish even more and hopes to have a better living. Weekly, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, 48 years old, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not worked properly for quite some time and he is therefore unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible but lacks the money to cover the cost of repairs. 

Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Farzana is so very thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Jovidjon

texts.en:
Since childhood, Jovidjon has had a dream to be a higher educated person. He studied at a school and got good marks. He did well such subjects as math, computers and English. 

After graduating school, Jovidjon entered the Tajikistan State University. Now, he is a student in the third year. He is one of the successful students. Jovidjon’s parents work in state organizations. They have not got enough money to pay for Jovidjon’s tuition at the university. Jovidjon is asking for a loan of 300 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for education at the university.

loans.name: Thi Thi's Group

texts.en:
Thi was born in 1973. She has three children. All of them are earning now. Her husband is a farmer with a monthly income of 2,000,000 VND. Thi is a business woman. She sells Vietnamese traditional cakes, rice soup, cakes, and candies to earn a living. Thi also raises chickens to diversify her family income. Every month, Thi's family income is 12,000,000 VND. 

Now Thi does not have to worry about two of her oldest sons, because all of them already have their own family. Thi only wishes that she will have enough money to open a carpentry workshop for her youngest son who is a skilled carpenter. This is the second time Thi is participating in SEDA's credit program. This time, Thi would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy rice and green beans to make Vietnamese traditional cakes. She expects that one day she will save enough money to fulfill her dream. 

Other members who are part of Thi’s group are included in the following list:
•	Ton was born in 1954. She has four children. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy pigs.
•	Nguyet was born in 1969. She has 2 children. She would love to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.
•	Hong was born in 1971. She has 2 children. She would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to invest in her carpentry workshop.
•	Tuong was born in 1986. He has 1 child. He want to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy rice and green beans

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en: Guljahon was born in 1976. She is married and has three children. For the last 15 years, Guljahon has been busy with farming but she has just a small income. Now, she is going to organize a new business with sewing. Her husband is a teacher in a school and has a small salary. He was very glad when heard about organizing a new business because he needs to support Guljahon. Guljahon is asking for a loan of 850 somoni to buy a sewing machine to organize her new sewing business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en: Feruza is a hardworking woman. She learned to sew national dresses when she lived in her parents’ house. Feruza is married and has one daughter. She is responsible mother and always tries to provide her child with all the necessities. She is going to organize her own sewing business because she can sew wonderful dresses. Feruza took part in the course “To get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 850 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region. Hayk is very happy to have his second loan with Kiva. The first loan, he used to purchase a large quantity of fodder for his farm animals and he also repaired his beehives. 

Hayk works at the Ijevan police station as policeman. He lives with his mother, with whom he manages all the farming activities. On his farm he has cows, goats, chickens, ducks, geese and several bee colonies. So the sale of these products is the main income for his family. 

Hayk is asking for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to buy three horses for his farm.

loans.use: to buy three horses for his farm.

loans.name: Mark Michael

texts.en:
Mark Michael is a hardworking person. He is 30 years of age and is operating a farming business. He has been running this business for over 15 years. He always gives his best to his work, which is his source of income, in order to achieve the best results.

Mark Michael is asking for additional working capital in the amount of PHP 12,000. He will use this amount to buy two bags of seeds, two bags of fertilizers and pay the fees of those who will perform transplanting on his farm land. He hopes through this loan, he will be able to obtain abundant crops and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bags of seeds, two bags of fertilizers and pay the costs of hired laborers.

loans.name: Raus

texts.en:
Raus is 53-years-old and a resident from the Stueng Saen district, Kampong Thom province.  Recently, she has been living separately from her husband due to unavoidable family circumstances so she lives with her son, who is employed in the construction industry.  Raus is in the business of selling breakfast in a local market, earning a net profit of USD 5.00 per day. She has been doing this for nearly 13 years.

As of now, Raus is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 1,500 to buy a motorcycle for her son's commute to his workplace. This purchase will minimize his expenses, since he usually pays for a taxi service. Raus thanks lenders for their generosities towards poor fellows like her to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son's commute to his workplace.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 30-year-old young woman who lives in the Ozurgeti district. She lives with her mother and sister. Nino's mother gets monthly assistance from the local government. Her sister is unemployed nowadays. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Nino was unable to study for a professional career. 

She is a hard worker, who puts much effort into helping her family to earn their living and cover the family's increasing needs. She works on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and nuts and has a small income from this activity, 100 Gel monthly. As the family has only seasonal income, Nino decided to start a trading business selling shoes. 

She wants to buy men's and women's shoes at wholesale prices and sell them locally for a good price. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3,200 will help Nino to purchase goods. This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Nino is thankful to Kiva's lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of shoes and start trading

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is from the Artsvanik village of the Syuniq region.  It has already been seven years that Bagrat has been providing a taxi service using his own car.  Over several years of hard work, Bagrat was able to gain many customers who prefer to go far distances only with him.  Since he is a very attentive and careful driver, people value the service that he provides.

Bagrat now needs your support for being able to renovate his car and purchase new tires. It is very important for Bagrat to bring the car in working condition and continue providing a taxi service. Because of the coming holiday season, there is high demand so Bagrat doesn’t want to lose that opportunity.  Bagrat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Bagrat lives together with his wife and wants to give her appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a renovation of his car and purchase new tires

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Puti with his wife and two school-age children. Shalva is busy with agricultural activities. He grows grapes in his own vineyard and sells them in the fall season. He works hard the whole year and harvests the quality products which are sold to fruit retailers. Additionally, the family runs an animal husbandry business and breeds three cows. 
With this loan, Shalva would like to purchase a tractor. He will use it to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly in tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by the landlords. He expects that this loan will significantly increase his family's funds and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a tractor

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, age 41, is from the small town of Rustavi. She is married and lives with her husband, in-laws, and two children. Inga’s economic activity is her small store where secondhand furniture is sold. Her husband runs a small bakery in the town and bakes Georgian bread. Inga wishes to start a second bread bakery in which traditional Georgian bread will be baked near her furniture store. The location is great and always crowded with people, which is the reason why the family thinks that the initiative will be lucrative. 

Inga has rented the commercial space and now needs the money to buy all the needed equipment and raw materials. Inga hopes her bakery will be profitable and the family will have an additional source of income.

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery in which traditional Georgian bread will be baked.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters/biogas for personal use and for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters/biogas for personal use and for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters/biogas for personal use and for resale

loans.name: Héctor Alejandro

texts.es:
El es   Héctor Alejandro quiere estudiar auxiliar en enfermería porque le agrada tener contacto directo con un paciente, le gusta sentir que es un apoyo para él/ella y que a pesar  de las circunstancias en las que se encuentran  va a  estar ahí para dar un consuelo, una compañía una ayuda.
Para el  la enfermería es un arte y mas que un arte es una  vocación de servicio, tuvo la oportunidad de tener experiencia y estar ayudando a pacientes de la  tercera edad y aprender un poco sobre esta carrera, fue muy gratificante para el.
Si logra   graduarse como auxiliar en enfermería seria un logro muy anhelado para el y la familia además q se sentiría orgulloso de ser un enfermero con capacidades e ilusiones para con la comunidad y la gente q necesita de el.
Agradece la atención prestada y espera poder ser parte del grupo de alumnos de la institución campo alto que cuentan con el convenio de kiva.
texts.en:
This is Héctor Alejando who is studying to be a nursing assistant because he likes having direct contact with patients. He likes feeling that he is helping them and that despite the circumstances that they are in he is going to be there to offer advice, companionship, and help.

Because nursing is an art and more than an art it is a vocation of service, he took the opportunity to work with and help elderly patients and to also learn a little about this field, which was very gratifying for him. If he graduates as a nursing assistant it would be a coveted achievement for him and his family and he would also be proud to be a capable nurse with vision for the community and the people who need him.

He appreciates the consideration of his loan and he hopes to be a part of the group of students from CampoAlto who receive a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer by profession. He is interested in purchasing goods for the shop. However, due to the lack of money, he is facing a problem.
Munawar is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Munawar hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 33, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two kids, and her husband is a sales agent. The store is her means of earning a living and supporting her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Rose keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Rose believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.
