Cuando se seca esta capa, repiten sucesivas capas de papel mojado con engrudo de almidón hasta que adquiera el grosor que desee dar el artesano.Después se despega con cuidado la máscara, que sale en bloque, y se perforan los agujeros de nariz y ojos. Se procede posteriormente a pegar dientes, orejas, cabellos, cerdas y cualquier otro agregado que lleve, como por ejemplo articulaciones de goma para dar movimiento. Se le adicionan los cuernos en el número que tradicionalmente señale el decorado y/o que sean propios de la región a que pertenece la careta.

Bernardina es madre sola y vive en casa de su tio junto con su mamá, ubicada en El Alto en la zona 16 de Febrero.

El sueño de Bernandina es tener en un mediano plazo un taller para desarrollar sus caretas y otras artesanías y al mismo tiempo obtener máxima eficiencia en los diferentes procesos de producción, lo que redunda en mayores volúmenes de fabricación, reducción en costos y mejora de la calidad de los productos y exportar al exterior. Asi mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de sus insumos en mayor cantidad para ahorrar en el costo.

Es la primeraa vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Bernardina spends her time decorating masks with plaster, chalk, paint, ornaments and other decorations. First, she creates a mold and applies a layer of paper. She almost always uses newspaper. This smooths the entire surface while fitting into irregularities in the mold. When the paper layer is dry, she repeats the process with additional layers of wet paper and a starch paste until the mask reaches the desired thickness. Afterward, she carefully peels back the mask which comes off in a block. Next, holes for the eyes and nose are drilled. She then proceeds to attach the teeth, ears, neck, hair bristles and any other addition such as rubber connections to allow movement. Horns are added based on the traditional number for decoration and/or the number specific to the region where the masks come from. 

Bernardina is a single mother and lives in her uncle's house with her mother. They live in El Alto in the area near 16 de Febrero.

Bernardina's dream in the medium term, is to have a shop where she can make masks and other crafts while at the same time reaching maximum efficiency in the various stages of production. This will result in higher product output, reduction in costs, better quality products, and the ability to export to other areas. This will increase her income and quality of life for her family. This loan is needed to buy materials in larger quantities as to save money in costs. 

This the first loan she has applied for with IMPRO and her first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy plaster, paint, and chalk wholesale in order to continue her business decorating masks and other crafts

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is from Yerevan town. He lives with his wife and his retired father. For many years, Vardan has been providing shoe repair services. From a rented store in Yerevan town, he receives different orders from his customers. Due to his good attitude and high quality work, Vardan receives many orders throughout the month, which helps him to cover his family's expenses. As the only worker in the family, he works hard to be able to sustain his family.


By applying for this loan, Vardan asks for financial support to be able to renovate the store where he provides his services. Vardan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vardan to be able to improve the working conditions and provide better service to his clients.

He hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovations to the rented store used to provide shoe repair services.

loans.name: Alimxan

texts.en: Alimxan is 24 years old, newly married, and lives with his wife in Baku region. Alimxan has been in the poultry business for two years. He has a few hens, cocks and chickens. Alimxan earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customers who are neighbors. Today his number of poultry is increasing  and he applied to Komak for a loan in amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to build a hen coop, buy some poultry, and increase his business. After increasing his business, the number of clients will increase and monthly income will be better. He says thank you to Kiva for the aid. In the future, Alimxan wants to have a poultry enterprise and to be a father of two children.

loans.use: to build a hen coop and buy some poultry.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en: Artemia is from Cortes, a town in Bohol. She is a 58-year-old woman with four grown children. She works hard at her business of buying and selling scraps to support her family's needs. This has been her business since her children were young. She usually buys empty bottles, scrap iron, empty cans and plastics. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more scrap items for resale, such as bottles, iron, plastic containers and metals. In the future, she would like to improve her business and make it even bigger so she can have better profits and save enough for old age.

loans.use: to buy more scrap items for resale, such as bottles, iron, plastic containers and metals.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, donde todas las integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y conforme a ello poder trabajar para superar su pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, ella tiene una despensa en su casa y tiene una buena clientela formada, en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada invirtiendo y poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para mantenerse.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, carnes, verduras, y demás, y agradece por esta oportunidad de poder trabajar y crecer que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación, where all the members are doing a survey to eliminate poverty.  They belong to the group so they can work to overcome their own poverty.  

One of the members is Antonia.  She has a grocery shop in her house and has a well-established clientele.  On her last survey she was above the poverty line, but she continues investing enthusiastically and putting her best effort into supporting herself.  

Antonia is seeking this loan to purchase supplies for her grocery such as drinks, meats, vegetables, etc..  She is grateful for the opportunity she's getting to be able to work and grow.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meats, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children who range from 14 to 24 years old. She describes herself as honest, and earns a living by running a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been in this business for 10 years, and works in a productive area where her primary customers are local residents. Consolata describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy farm supplies. She is requesting a Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm supplies because this will allow her grow more crops and increase production. Her goal for the future is to improve her family's living standards. She also does dairy farming on the side as a way to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 48 años de edad, se ha dedicado a vender mercancía por catálogo desde hace varios años, idea que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar las necesidades de su familia, conformada por su esposo y 3 hijos. Gracias a su trayectoria es reconocida por sus clientes, quienes la visitan constantemente, pues posee una vitrina ubicada en la sala de su casa, donde exhibe gran parte de los productos que ofrece.
Hace algunos meses su familia pasó por una crisis económica, pues su esposo e hijo mayor se habían quedado desempleados y ella tuvo que asumir toda la carga económica; sin embargo, con empuje, perseverancia y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. El crédito que solicita es una alternativa para comprar mercancía al por mayor (cremas corporales, productos faciales, shampoo, perfumes, entre otros), así tendrá la capacidad para solventar las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorará los ingresos, con los que seguirá solventando los gastos familiares y fortalecer su negocio, para que este crezca y permanezca en el tiempo; abriendo la posibilidad para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, at the age of 48, has been selling merchandise through a catalogue for several years. The idea was born from a need to generate an income to cover the needs of her family: her husband and three children. Thanks to her hard work, she is recognized by her clients who are constantly visiting her. She has a display case in a room of her home where she displays a large quantity of her products.
Several months ago her family had an economic crisis. Her husband and eldest child lost their jobs and she had to take on responsibility for the entire household. However, with hard work, perseverance, and dedication, she has been able to get ahead. This loan is to help her buy merchandise wholesale (body creams, facial products, shampoo, perfume, etc). This way, she will have the capacity to supply her customers' demand, and her income will improve. With this, she will continue to cover her family's costs and strengthen her business so that it will grow and survive, providing her with the possibility of having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (body creams, facial products, shampoo, perfume, etc).

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz, con 33 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 12 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Durante 13 años de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleada en diferentes tiendas y cafeterías, en las que obtuvo experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, pero, hace 7 años decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, una charcutería ubicada en el centro del municipio donde reside, en el que cuenta con la ventaja de estar rodeado de diversos almacenes por lo que la afluencia de personas es constante; trabaja sola todos los días y, así ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos y necesidades familiares; a pesar de los desafíos que se le presentaron hace algunos años, debido a la ola de violencia por la que pasaba el municipio, sin embargo, con esfuerzo, dedicación y perseverancia ha logrado salir adelante.
El crédito desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (licor, cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros), esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda en la temporada de fin de año, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que obtiene por su labor.
Beatriz manifiesta que su objetivo principal es adquirir un local más amplio para convertir su negocio en un restaurante, que le genere una rentabilidad para poder cumplir su mayor anhelo, que es tener la capacidad de brindar a su hijo una educación de calidad, para que sea un hombre íntegro y se forje un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 33, is a mother of a 12-year-old son and lives in a civil union with her partner.  For 13 years of her professional life she worked as an employee in different stores and coffee shops where she got the experience and know-how in managing these kinds of business, but 7 years ago she decided to strike out and start her own business - a delicatessen located in the middle of the town where she lives, and where she has the advantage of being surrounded by different stores, so that the flow of people is constant.

She works everyday and because of this has generated enough income to support the costs and needs of her family, in spite of the challenges which she has been presented with over the years, owing to the wave of violence which passed through the city.  Nevertheless, with sacrifice, dedication and perseverance she has been able to manage.

She wants to invest the loan in buying a wholesale supply (liquor, beers, sodas, snacks, etc).  This will allow her to satisfy the demand in for the year-end holiday season, improving her sales and the income she earns from her work.

Beatriz states that her main goal is to get a larger place to transform into her business int a restaurant to generate profitability and be able to complete her 
bigger wish, which is to be able to to give her son a quality education so that he can be an upstanding man and forge a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy a wholesale selection (liquor, beer, soda, snacks, etc)

loans.name: Ularbek

texts.ru: Уларбек 39 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Уларбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Уларбек занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уларбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 1 теленок, 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,48 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уларбек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Уларбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Ularbek is 39 years old, married, and together with his wife raising three children. Ularbek has a high school education, and as the main source of income for his family Ularbek manages livestock which he began doing 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 Kyrgyztani Somoni. Through hard work Ularbek today has on his farm two dairy cows, two heifers, one calf, five sheep, and also a plot of land measuring 0.48 hectares on which he grows beans, potatoes, and hay. His monthly income is 10,000 Kyrgyzstani Somoni. In order to further develop his farm, Ularbek applied to the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase sheep to increase the population of his livestock. With the income from the loan, Ularbek plans to further invest in augmenting his amount of domesticated animals, and plans to save enough money to purchase more plots of land.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, caracterizada por tener grandes depósitos de ripio y piedra que la población utiliza para construcción de viviendas, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de patos, pavos, cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Rosa se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, son una familia unida su esposo brinda servicios agrícolas y ocasionalmente de pesca.

Rosita como así la conocen, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband in the district of Cayaltí, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock, characterized by having large deposits of gravel and stone that the population uses for housing construction.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She makes a living raising ducks, turkeys and guinea pigs.  Her business is located in the back part of her house.  Rosa works at this job to help her husband with the family expenses.  They are a close family.  Her husband provides agricultural services and occasionally fishes. 

Rosita, as she is known, has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN) for the purchase of balanced feed for fattening her animals and in this way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nyahururu. She is married and blessed with two children who are 15 and 12 years old. For the last nine years, she has earned a living by selling clothes, and has applied for her fourth loan, for KES. 50,000, from VisionFund Kenya to buy more items to sell. Her monthly income is KES. 20,000 and she intends to use the profits she earns from her expanded business to educate her children, pay back her loan and start a new business as a way to earn more income. In the future, Rahab hopes to own the biggest clothing boutique in her area.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 45-year-old married woman who hails from Cortes, Bohol. She has four children. She has been in the food vending business for 16 years. She sells suman (a rice cake made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed in banana leaves), biko (a Filipino sweet sticky traditional rice cake that is made of glutinous rice or malagkit, coconut milk or gata) and puto (the Filipino term for “rice cake”, which is cooked by steaming). She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, coconuts, sugar and milk. 

In the future, Avelina would like to expand her business to further increase business profitability and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, coconuts, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Mbarete quiere decir en castellano, mujer fuerte, y eso es lo que son estas mujeres, personas fuertes que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo de todas y cada una de ellas. Son mujeres jefas de familia que están trabajando arduamente. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Eulalia es parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, quien vende prendas de variadas clases y que con mucho esfuerzo esta pudiendo ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que muestra sus ganas de salir adelante. Pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar mas prendas para la venta.
texts.en:
Kuña Mbarete means "strong woman", and that is what these women are. They are strong people who want to help their families through their work. They are heads of their families and are working very hard. They are also part of Fundacion Paraguaya's poverty elimination program.
Eulalia is part of this group of hard-working women. She sells varied garments, and with great hard work is able to help her family. She is a very hard-working person who demonstrates a desire to get ahead. She is requesting this loan because she needs to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: to buy garments for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Argemira

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo, paciencia y dedicación. Ha sido ama de casa y al mismo tiempo se ha desempeñado como confeccionista; aprendió el oficio gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y ella comenzó su labor, haciendo su propio vestido de novia con el cual soñaba. Hoy en día, a sus 58 años de edad y 37 años realizando este oficio, tiene su propio taller ubicado en la comodidad de su vivienda, allí presta el servicio de confección a terceros, con lo que ha generado ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar. 
El crédito que solicita, es un apoyo para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, pues requiere comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, elásticos, botones, hilos, entre otros), con lo que estará en la capacidad que cumplir con todos los pedidos de una manera oportuna y con materiales de buena calidad, así mejorará notablemente las ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Gloria tiene como propósito acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y en un futuro cercano delegar las funciones a sus hijos para que sean ellos quienes sigan con la microempresa que con tanta dedicación y sacrificio inició; además manifiesta que desea disfrutar una vejez tranquila y en compañía de todos los que ama.
texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with 4 children whom she has gotten ahead with great effort, patience, and dedication.  She's been a homemaker as well as a seamstress, which she learned from her mother.  She started by making her own wedding dress of her dreams.  Now she's 58 and has been in business for 37 years.  She has her own workshop, situated in the comfort of her house, where she offers her services to others.  She's been making income to help her husband out with family finances.  

The loan Gloria is seeking will help her continue to strengthen her business.  She needs to buy supplies wholesale, like fabric, elastic, buttons, thread, etc., to fill all her orders in a timely fashion.  With high-quality materials she'll be able to drastically improve sales and the income she receives for her work.  

Gloria's goal is to prove and strengthen her business, and in the near future delegate the job to her children so they can be the ones to keep up the small business that she started up with such dedication and sacrifice.  In addition she says she wants to enjoy a peaceful old age in the company of all of those she loves.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (fabrics, elastic, buttons, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is from Apeni, a village in Lagodekhi region. He is 26 years old and lives with his father. His family is involved in agricultural activities. Lasha and his father cultivate agricultural land and grow vegetables and maize, which are sold to the local market. This income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family.  As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Lasha wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily expenses of his family. 

Lasha received credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a great support to this hardworking man and his family, enabling him to purchase cattle, and after raising the cattle, he will get significant earnings. Lasha relies on the goodwill of the lenders and greatly appreciates their support.

loans.use: To start a business buying and selling cattle.

loans.name: Nisbat

texts.en: Nisbat was born in 1956. She is married and has five children. Since 2011, Nisbat has been busy growing agricultural products. She grows vegetables such as onions, carrots, etc. She grows vegetables in her orchard because she has a big orchard. From her profits, Nisbat has been able to improve her living conditions little by little. Nisbat is a careful mother. She is going to plant vegetables and is asking for a loan of 3,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard has been involved in a retail business for four years. She buys and sells different types of products (fruits, vegetables and other food items), which she purchases from nearby open markets. She has an agreement with small stores to whom she provides fresh fruits and vegetables. 

Sirvard lives together with her husband. They both work hard to be able to sustain their living. Because of many difficulties that Sirvard and her husband are currently facing, Sirvard isn't able to purchase new stock of supplies for reselling. That's the reason she has applied for this loan. The loan will greatly assist her in purchasing vegetables and fruits for resale. 

Sirvard has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will help Sirvard to increase her turnover and will greatly assist her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жылдыз - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жылдыз занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также имеется небольшой земельный надел на котором сажает картофель, тыкву и многолетние травы. У Жылдыз имеется яблоневый сад, который приносит хороший урожай и доходы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jyldyz is 32 years old and married. She and her husband are bringing up three children. Jyldyz is a college graduate. She works as a teacher in a local secondary school. As an additional source of income for her family, Jyldyz raises livestock, having launched this business 10 years ago by buying livestock for 7,000 KGS. Thanks to Jyldyz' hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow and a small land plot, where Jyldyz grows potatoes, pumpkins and perennial herbs. Jyldyz also has an apple orchard yielding a good harvest and revenue. Her monthly revenue is 8,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Jyldyz turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan   to increase her livestock by buying a cow. Jyldyz plans to use the income from her loan for an further additional livestock increase. She plans to save money to cover further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and lives in Bien Unido, Bohol, where she earns a living by making and selling both fresh and salted fish. She has been in the business for more than ten years, and is requesting this loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions by increasing both her sales and her income. In the future, Evelyn hopes that her business will be a bigger success than it is now.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and salt for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 39 years old from Nakuru. She is married and blessed with one child aged seven years. For the past two years she has sold mobile phone accessories. Her monthly income right now is 10,000 KES.

Daisy has applied for a third loan of 70,000 KES through VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock for her business. She has plans of using the profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her child and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future Daisy hopes to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more stock of phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Sixta en su negocio de venta de comidas pues con su crédito obtuvo mayores ganancias al invertirlo en materias primas e insumos, hoy el negocio tiene mayor movilidad porque la rotación de compras es mayos ayudandola a disminuír los costos que de ella se derivan. Ella dice a  sus finaciadores de Kiva " Gracias por el apoyo y hoy requeire comprar una nevera de mayor tamaño, por eso solicita un nuevo finaciamiento, con el cual mejorará la capacidad de almacenamiento de los productos perecederos, para seguir desarrollando su negocio.
texts.en:
Thanks for the support given to Sixta in her business selling food.  With her loan she obtained greater profits by investing it in raw materials and supplies.  Today the business has greater mobility because the turnover of purchases is greater, helping her to reduce the costs that arise from them.  She says to the Kiva lenders, “Thank you for the support.”  

Today she needs to purchase a larger refrigerator.  For this she is requesting a new loan with which she will improve the storage capacity of perishable products and continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a larger refrigerator.

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides es una mujer casada de 52 años de edad que habita  al sur de la ciudad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 22 y 27 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, que se dedica al comercio, actividad por la cual recibe ingresos, así como también los genera, por un local que alquila y debe estar bien acondicionado para responder a sus arrendatarios. El comercio es una de las actividades que siempre le ha gustado, especialmente la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos, acción que realiza desde el año 2000, cuando inició promoviendo artículos con sus vecinos y poco a poco ha agregado nuevos clientes. Sus ventas las realizan todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y ofrece diversas mercancías como accesorios femeninos, cosméticos etc, de contado y a crédito. Su meta mas adelante es tener un punto de distribución, tipo miscelánea donde su clientela obtenga todo los que necesiten y a nivel familiar sueña con ver realizados a sus hijos en sus hogares. Su mayor desafío es incrementar sus ingresos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, para aumentar su potencial de compras de mercancías, pues es tiempo de aprovechar las ofertas de los proveedores y adecuar el local con el fin de arrendarlo en un mayor valor. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con lo cual aprovecharía oportunidades en sus compras en mayor volumen  de cosméticos, accesorios femeninos etc y acreditaría su local.
texts.en:
52-year old Idalides is married and has two children aged 22 and 27. She lives in the south part of town. She is an enterprising businesswoman as she both receives income and generates income from premises that she rents out and has to keep well-maintained for her tenants. 

Idalides has always enjoyed business, especially selling from specialized catalogs--a job she's been doing since 2000. At that time she began selling to her neighbours and gradually added new customers. She works from 8 am to 8pm and sells a variety of merchandise such as women's accessories and cosmetics, both for cash and on account.

Her future goal is to have premises where her customers can buy everything they need. On a personal level her dream is to see her children with houses of their own. 

Idalides' biggest challenge is to increase her income; for this reason she is seeking a Kiva loan so she can increase her purchasing power. It is the time of year to take advantage of special offers from distributors. She also wants to renovate the store so she can rent it for more money.

This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy large volumes of merchandise such as cosmetics and women's accessories, and to license her store.

loans.use: Buy larger quantities of cosmetics and women's accessories, and construction materials to renovate her premises

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en: Silvana is requesting a new loan to buy more used items to sell to her customers. The income that she's been generating from her business helps her buy food for her children, something her family not take for granted when other children in their community do not have food, Silvana explains.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, shoes and electrical home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is a kind woman. She is married with four children and lives with her family in the southern region of Tajikistan. Rohat supports the family because her husband hasn’t a job.

For more than five years Rohat has run a dairy. With her husband’s help she cares for their cows and sells milk and kefir to the local community. She works hard, but her income is still not sufficient to improve the family’s living conditions.

Rohat wants to increase her working capital and maximize profits. She is applying for a 6000 TJS loan through IMON International to buy more cows. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Mario tiene 55 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su carro. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Sol y Luna communal bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco region.

Group member Mario is 55 years old.  He lives with his partner and has three children.  He alternates doing his daily activities with offering taxi services.  He has been doing this type of work for some time now.  It is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day.  This member is a responsible and diligent person, and because of this he has gotten his family ahead.

Mario is asking for the loan to buy spare parts for his car.

The other group members run a photocopy business, a grocery store, and a food sales business.

Mario is thankful to those who have helped fulfill his dream in this way, and he has committed himself to making his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Suhrobsho

texts.en:
Suhrobsho, who lives with his wife and four children, has been the owner of 3.72 hectares of land in the southern part of Tajikistan since 2013. A very hardworking man who enjoys farming, Suhrobsho grows wheat maize, peas, cucumber and watermelon on his land, which is located two kilometers from his home. 

Selling his harvest in a local market, last year he bought all necessary food products from the profits earned by a good season. As the new season approaches, Suhrobsho  is requesting a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nyahururu. She is married and the mother of seven children who range in age from two to 16 years old. Jane earns a living by selling charcoal and has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000, and is requesting her first loan, for KES. 43,700, from VisionFund Kenya  to pay school fees. She plans to use her monthly income to pay off her loan, continue to educate her children and expand her charcoal-selling business. In future she also hopes to begin farming.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Zeliha

texts.en: Zeliha is a 48-year-old divorced mother of one who lives in a city in central Albania. For about ten years, she has been operating a clothing store, and this has been their only source of income. She is applying for a loan to buy inventory of clothing to sell. This will be her second loan from the institution. “There are so many people in our city selling clothes and the competition is enormous. There is also the Roma market considered the largest in the country that sells second hand clothes and other thrifty items. However, I am lucky because I do not pay rent for the store,” said Zeliha.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian es de la ciudad Punta Suerte, comenta que tuvo que dejar su hogar para venir a la ciudad de Santaní a buscar un mejor futuro, y gracias a la ayuda de sus padres está llegando a su meta.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y comenta que su sueño siempre ha sido poder ayudar a las personas, y más en esto que es tan importante, que es la salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, que le ayudará a cubrir los gastos que tendrá.
texts.en:
Lilian is from the city of Punta Suerte and says she had to leave her home to come to the city of Santaní to search for a better future. Thanks to the help of her parents she is on her way to her goal. 

She is studying nursing and says that her dream has always been to help other people, especially with the important issue of health. 

She asks for this loan in order to invest it in her degree fees, which will help her cover the costs that she will have.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her master's degree.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Agustin” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas ellas se dedican a la actividad rural de cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás. 
Son de una zona rural, en crecimiento, y si se puede decir con poca seguridad. Hilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados varios para poder alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
The “San Agustin” communal bank was formed by several neighbors from the city of Santaní. All of them engage in the rural activity of breeding and selling barnyard animals, such as chickens, pigs, goats, and others. They live in a rural area which is growing but, it can be said, is not very safe. 

Hilda is one of the members of this communal bank. She asks for this loan to use it to buy different types of feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una joven que quiere salir adelante y ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las personas.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, con lo cual quiere poder aprender y el día de mañana ser una profesional exitosa que pueda servir a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en gastos de su universidad, y así seguir estudiando y luchando por ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Marlene is a young woman who wants to succeed and be a professional able to help others.  

She's studying accounting, which she wants to learn and then become a successful professional who is able to serve society.

Marlene is seeking this loan to pay for university expenses so she can continue studying and fighting to become a quality professional.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
anco es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, donde esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial, poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder sobresalir en lo que quiere como carrera.
Es una persona que tiene muchas ansias de poder crecer e ir mejorando en cada cosa que hace, ya que por medio de eso también podrá ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Anco is from the city of San Ignacio where he's studying for an Industrial Engineering degree.  He's putting in his best effort to be able to stand out in his chosen career.  

Anco is a person who really longs to be able to grow and keep improving in everything he does, and by doing so also be able to help out his family.

He is requesting this loan to pay for university expenses so he can carry on toward his goal.

loans.use: to pay for university costs.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES VALIENTES están en el 1er. ciclo con 16 integrantes, por medio del esfuerzo de todas, quieren poder ayudar a sus familias a crecer y darles todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes la señora Candida, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es bastante emprendedora y muy activa, el crédito que pide quiere invertirlo en la compra de ropas. Ella comenta que sale sobre su moto a vender las prendas que tiene por todo el barrio y las zonas rurales del distrito, es una señora con ganas de superarse y muy capaz de obtener muchas clientelas por su amabilidad y gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mujeres Valientes", and they are in their first loan cycle. The group has 16 members and through the efforts of all, they want to help their families get ahead and give them all that they themselves could not have.

One of the members is Candida. She sells clothing and is very enterprising and active. She is asking for a loan to invest it in buying clothes. She says that she travels by motorbike to sell her clothes in her neighborhood and in rural areas nearby. She is a woman who wants to excel and who can get many clients because of her kindness and great entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: María Dignora

texts.es:
María es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho empeño y dedicación. Durante su vida productiva, trabajó por 13 años en una empresa industrial de acero, luego decidió independizarse y con la liquidación que recibió, pudo montar su almacén de variedades, en el que trabaja todos los días de 9 am a 9 pm y tiene la ventaja de poder generar recursos al mismo tiempo que está pendiente de su familia. Allí ofrece diversos productos y para la temporada de navidad, desea comprar más mercancía al por mayor (productos de aseo personal, accesorios, productos de papelería, juguetes, artículos decorativos, entre otros), por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito; así tendrá la posibilidad de satisfacer los requerimientos y diversos gustos de sus clientes, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
María se proyecta para tener un futuro más próspero, pues desea seguir trabajando arduamente para fortalecer más su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará el bienestar de su familia y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a married woman with 2 children whom she has gotten ahead with great determination and dedication.  During her working life she worked for 13 years at an industrial steel company and then decided to go out on her own.  With the severance pay she got she was able stock up her grocery store where she works every day from 9AM to 9PM.  She has the advantage of being able to make an income while tending her family.  She sells a variety of products as well as items for the Christmas season.  She wants to buy more merchandise wholesale (personal hygiene products, accessories, stationery products, toys, decorative items, etc.).  She's seeking the support of a loan so she'll be able to satisfy the requirements and diverse tastes of her customers, thus increasing sales and the income she makes for her labor.  

María is positioning herself for a more prosperous future.  She wants to keep working arduously to further strengthen her business and create job opportunities so she can improve her family's well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (personal hygiene  products, accessories, stationery products, toys, decorative items, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat and other food products before prices start to increase.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun, aged 37, is married and has three children. He operates a rice farming business in Kampong Thom province, while his wife helps him earn income by selling fish in a local market in their region. Nun has been engaged in farming for almost 20 years, and he earns approximately KHR 30,000 per day. He generally uses his income to provide meals for his family and to give adequate allowances to his children. To help him develop his farming business further, Nun is taking out a new loan to buy a piece of land and enlarge his farming area. In the next harvest season, he hopes to have better crop yields and thus augment the family income.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to enlarge his rice farm.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 25-year-old married woman from Naivasha. They have two children, ages 2 and 5 years old.

Ann has a grocery business that she has been running for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 to enable her to buy bananas, vegetables, onions, and tomatoes. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. She also hopes to improve her living standards after the loan.

loans.use: to buy bananas, vegetables, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 35 years old, from Naivasha, and married. They have three children who are between 15 years and six years old. Pauline has a clothing business that she has been running for three years. She has applied for her first loan, of KES 30,000, from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. Pauline will use the profits from her business to help cover her family's needs. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 26 years old and lives with his parents and 2 siblings in their small house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He has a girlfriend and is planning on moving in together next summer. He is now preparing their new home for them. 

Naranbaatar is a very hardworking, clever and enthusiastic young man who has started working since he was a university student. He is now running a butcher shop business and buys livestock or meat products from herders in the countryside and sells to Ulaanbaatar city residents. From his business profit he has built small house to eventually live in with his girlfriend, and now needs to purchase and place furniture.

He is requesting loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders and sell to Ulaanbaatar city residents for Lunar New year celebration.

loans.use: to purchase meat products to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Soy casado desde hace mas de 25 años sin dependientes económicos.
He sido mecánico toda mi vida. Mi padre me enseño el valor del trabajo desde pequeño gracias a eso desde hace cinco años logre poner mi refraccionaria. El préstamo lo utilizare para surtir mi negocio y pintar la fachada del mismo.
Mis logros son que a base de esfuerzo y trabajo obtuve mi casa y refaccionaria.
texts.en:
Martin is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

“I have been married for more than 25 years and have no dependents. I have been a mechanic all my life. My father taught me the value of work at an early age and thanks to this I opened my own auto repair shop five years ago. I will use the loan to supply my business and to paint the shop front. My accomplishments are that through struggling and working I obtained my home and auto repair shop.”

loans.use: to buy auto repair supplies and to spruce up his motor vehicle repair workshop

loans.name: Junrry

texts.en: Junrry is 32 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependent. Junrry earns a living from the income of his motorcycle jabal-jabal for hire, and also from coconut farming and from honorarium as a Barangay Councilor. He is earning an approximate amount of PHP 4,000 from these activities. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing motorcycle spare parts like tires, tubes, chains and rings to repair his motorcycle. Junrry became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Junrry hopes to engage in a different type of business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his transportation business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Martha en su negocio comercial, pues con su credikiva logró comprar productos cosméticos, electrodomésticos y variedades y tiene un mayor surtido. Sus ingresos han mejorado y con ello los de su familia. Martha dice a sus finaciadores: 2Muchas gracias, por el apoyo económico recibido, pido que continuen apoyandome, para mejorar mis ingresos y el d emi familia. " En la actualidad Martha está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos que llegaron en los catalogos con descuentos especiales, variedades femeninas y accesorios varios. Así, con este nuevo crédito, tendrá un fondo de efectivo para comprar de contado, mientras recibe los pagos de sus clientes, con las ventas a crédito que antes realizó.Aumentando sus ventas y sus utilidades, que constituyen el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Martha in her retail business. With her Kiva loan, she managed to buy cosmetics, electric appliances, and knick-knacks, and have a larger stock of items.  Her income has increased and also that of her family.  Martha says to her lenders: “Thank you very much for the financial support I received.  I ask you to please keep supporting me, to improve my earnings and those of my family.” 

Currently, Martha is asking for another Kiva loan, with which she will buy cosmetics from catalogs with special discounts, feminine knick-knacks, and various accessories.  Thus, with this new loan, she will have a fund to pay with cash. Meanwhile, she’ll receive payment from her customers for the sales on credit she made to them before, increasing her sales and the profits that make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, feminine knick-knacks, and various accessories

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has 7 children. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, milk, soap, sugar, fabric and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a highly productive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of bread, milk, sugar, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to add stock of bread, milk, sugar, and other items to his store

loans.name: Rafael Abdon

texts.es:
Rafael de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo año del colegio, es soltero y vive junto con su mamá. Tiene 2 hermanos, uno de ellos ya se acompañó y formó su familia aparte, el otro emigró hacia los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida.

Rafael siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo, laborando en diferentes tareas como la siembra de maíz, maicillo, frijol etc. pero son los cerdos el rubro que más le gusta, los compra cuando están tiernitos, los engorda y luego los destaza para vender la carne en la comunidad, ya lleva 2 años dedicándose a esta actividad, su madre lo apoya también brindándole consejos y algún aporte económico si la situación lo amerita. 

Con el préstamo,  pretende comprar entre uno o 2 cerdos dependiendo del tamaño, y así seguir haciendo lo que le gusta, obteniendo ganancias que utilizaría en inversión e ir creciendo en el negocio.

Sueña con llegar a tener su propia ganadería porcina, con la cual establecerse económicamente, para así en un futuro formar un hogar en el que pueda cubrir todas las necesidades básicas que requiere una familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is 20 years old and studied up to the 7th grade in school.  He is single and lives with his mother. He has two brothers; one lives independently with his life partner, and the other emigrated to the United States in search of a better life. 

Rafael has always worked in the fields at various jobs such as planting corn, sorghum, beans, etc., but he likes working with pigs the most.  He buys them when they are piglets, fattens them up and then he butchers them to sell the meat in the community.  He has been doing this for two years, and his mother supports him by offering her advice and when necessary, she provides some economic support as well. 

With the loan, he plans to buy one or two pigs depending on their size.  This will allow him to continue doing what he likes while earning money which he will use to invest and grow his business. He dreams of having his own pig farm and establishing himself financially so that one day he will be able to have his own home and cover all the basic necessities a family requires.

loans.use: to buy one or two pigs, depending on their size.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a mother of three children, ages 15, 12, and 7 years old. All of her children attend school.

Robinah owns and operates a retail shop which she started in 2008. It is located in Nyakatoma cell C. She works six hours a day and is determined to grow her business from one level to another. She is, however, challenged by limited capital. This leaves the business with almost nothing to sell. In addition to the retail business, Robinah has rentals which give her additional income in a given period.

Robinah started the business with an objective to make money to support her family. She would like to use the UGX 800,000 to buy more stock so she can serve her customers with a variety of products. Her clients are mainly people from the neighborhood. She hopes they will buy more if she restocks her shop. Her biggest challenge are the untrustworthy employees who swindle her money, hence leaving her with nothing. But she hopes to manage the business herself to make more profits. She will use the profits to provide for her family members and to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy daily household use items to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Erika tiene 32 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos; un hombre de 15 y su nena de 6 años. Vive, junto con sus hijos, en casa de su mamá y ella describe a su familia como muy unida.

Ella tiene un negocio en un parque en el centro de Chalco, Estado de México en el que vende corsetería, playeras, fondos, blusas y ropa de temporada. El puesto, el cual lo atiende junto con su mamá, abre de sábado a jueves de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm. Solicita este crédito para comprar mercancía en mayor volumen y poderle ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

El principal logro de Erika es que su negocio ha crecido, pues empezaron solamente con un carrito y ahora ya tienen un local; a su vez, gracias a su trabajo su patrimonio ha crecido y ha podido proveer para sus hijos. Su principal reto es hacer más grande su negocio y en un futuro poner otro.
texts.en:
Erika is a customer of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Erika is 32 years old and single. She has two children; a 15-year-old young man and her 6-year-old baby girl. She lives with her two children in her mother's house, and she describes her family as very close-knit.

She owns a business in a park located in downtown Chalco, state of Mexico. There she sells undergarments, t-shirts, slips, and seasonal clothing. Her sales stand, which she runs alongside her mother, is open Saturday through Thursday, from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. She requests this loan in order to purchase merchandise in bulk so she can offer a wider variety to her customers.

Erika's main achievement is that her business has grown, since they started off with only a cart and now they already have a venue. At the same time, thanks to her work she has increased her assets and has been able to provide for her children. Her main challenge is to expand her business and someday establish another business.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her business, especially seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa están en el noveno Ciclo con 15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, ellas son de una zona rural, donde cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por ayudar a su comunidad y poder crecer.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, luchando y esforzándose por una vida mejor. Vilma pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir con la cría.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its ninth cycle with 15 members. It is a group distinguished in the area for being very united and responsible. The women are from a rural area and each one is doing her best to help her community and to grow.
All of these women raise and sell barnyard animals. They work hard for a better life. Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of animal feed so that she can continue with raising animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Evelyn Marisol

texts.es: Evelyn de  20 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de tres años de edad. Ella se gana la vida trabajando como empleada en una tienda cercana a su localidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para el cual desea comprar adobes (mescla de tierra mojada con zacate seco), pagar la mano de obra para la construcción del mismo.
texts.en: Evelyn is 20 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and three year old young son.  She works at a nearby local store and earns a living this way.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can improve her living conditions and build a room.  She wants to buy adobe (a mixture of wet dirt and grass) and pay for labor to do the work.

loans.use: to buy adobe and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María de 72 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. María se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y cerrar con lámina la parte frontal de la vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada y madera y así proceder a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maria is 72 years old and has lived in a home of her own with her family for a long time.  Maria is a merchant, has had a store for a long time, and has earned a living and supported her household this way.  She wants to repair the roof and close off the front part of the house with metal.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy galvanized metal and lumber so she can begin making the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: Para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera  para reparar el techo y cerrar la parte frontal de la vivienda.

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Amalio tiene 39 años, está casado con la Sra. Norma de  36 años, Actualmente tienen 2 Hijos en  edad escolar, quienes son el motivo de lucha de ambos, y por quienes ponen su mayor esfuerzo.
Amalio tiene una despensa y carnicería en su casa particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, y se destaca en el barrio por ser una persona servicial, y que siempre es muy amable con todos.
           
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, enlatados, hortalizas y demás, que le ayudará a poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Amalio, age 39, is married to Norma, age 36.  They now have two school age children.  They both struggle for the children, and it is for them that they put forth their greatest effort.

Amalio has a grocery store and butcher shop in his house.  He has a customer base and good income.  He stands out in the neighborhood for being a helpful person, and he is very kind to everyone.

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy greens, meat, canned goods, vegetables, and the rest.  This will help him to be able to continue working like he is doing.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, canned goods, vegetables, and the rest.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es considerado un padre y esposo ejemplar, trabajador y humilde; a sus 33 años de edad, se desempeña como electricista automotriz, actividad a la que se ha dedicado durante toda su vida productiva. Hace algunos meses inició su propio taller cerca al tránsito del municipio donde reside; allí trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm; así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para brindar el sustento a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad.
El crédito será destinado para comprar un osciloscopio, con el que podrá mejorar el rendimiento en sus trabajos, pues podrá medir las señales eléctricas con mayor agilidad y precisión; así estará en la capacidad de atender mayor número de clientes, lo que le dará mejor rentabilidad.
Luis manifiesta que su objetivo a corto plazo es tener un negocio muy bien posicionado en el mercado, que le garantice una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y ofrecerles un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, 33, is considered to be an exemplary husband and father. He is hard-working and humble. He has been an automobile electrician for his entire productive life. Several months ago he opened his own workshop near to the central area of his municipality. He works there every day from 7 am to 7 pm. This is how he has generated a sufficient income to provide for his wife and two children, ages 11 and 2.
He will use this loan to buy an oscilloscope. With this purchase, he will be able to increase his profitability; he will be able to measure the electrical signals with greater flexibility and precision. This will allow him to increase his capacity for attending to customers, which will make his business more profitable.
Luis says that his short-term goal is to have a business that is well-positioned in the market and guarantees profitability and economic stability so that he can give his children a better education and offer them better well-being.

loans.use: to buy an oscilloscope.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 15 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Ella se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos en casas particulares por lo que recibe un salario que le permite llevar el sustento a su hijo y a su hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en los materiales que le hacen falta para terminar su  vivienda ya que no ha podido terminarla por falta de recursos económicos. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Ana is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 15 year old son and some relatives.  She earns a living by providing domestic services in private homes and she supports her son and household in this way.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy building materials to complete her home, since she has not been able to do so due to a lack of financial resources.  She will use the money from this loan to buy galvanized metal and lumber.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María es una mujer casada  y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Desde hace varios años, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía por encargo y plan separe; inició en el oficio por medio de una hermana que realizaba la misma labor, poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo del negocio, luego su hermana se retiró de la labor y ella quedó con todos los contactos y la clientela y ahora ya es reconocida en el sector.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, ropa interior, blusas, entre otros), esto le permitirá cumplir con su proyección de ventas para la temporada de navidad, además tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorará los ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
María sueña con poder independizar su negocio de la unidad familiar, por lo que sigue luchando para poder arrendar un local mucho más amplio y con mejor imagen, que proyecte estilo y atraiga a más clientes; así podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
María is married and has two children whom she has supported with great hard work. For several years, she has worked as an independent merchant, selling merchandise on credit and special plans. She started this work through a sister who was doing the same thing. Bit by bit she gained knowledge and experience in business management, and then her sister retired and left her all her contacts and clientele. She is now very well-known in the area.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (jeans, underwear, blouses, etc). This will allow her to achieve her sales projection for the Christmas season. She will also have a greater variety to offer her clients and improve her income in order to cover the household costs.
Maria dreams of having her business independent from her family. She continues to work hard so she can rent out a larger storefront with a better image that projects style and attracts more clients. This way, she will be able to benefit from a greater quality of life with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (jeans, underwear, blouses, and other items).

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is a 39-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three little children in a small village, Dioknisi, in the Khulo district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has agricultural land where he grows potatoes, maize and nuts. He is a very hardworking man and always has high-quality products, which are sold locally. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time with only a 250 GEL income, Pridon decided to expand his business activities in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. Pridon decided to start his own business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to open a secondhand clothing store. Pridon thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the store is opened, the family will have a stable income, which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  

With the support of the Start Up program, Pridon will have an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a secondhand clothing store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 65- year old widow; she lives in RS tan Village, Maningcol, Ozamiz City. Rosita has had her food business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000.00 to purchase additional stocks for her business on food supplement.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her living conditions and to make her business become successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a master's degree course.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married, 32-year-old woman from Naivasha. They have two children, ages two and seven years old. Rachael has a grinding business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy maize for grinding. Rachael is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy maize for grinding.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
Marta de 40 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos no asistió a la escuela,  debido a que sus padres no tenían el ingreso suficiente como para proporcionarle el estudio a ella. Actualmente,  está casada el esposo trabaja en la capital como vigilante y solo viene a la casa a los 15 días,  ya que por su trabajo no puede estar más tiempo con ella y sus dos hijos.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar,  ya que desde que era niña se ha dedicado a este oficio, como no tuvo una formación académica, se vio obligada  a trabajar desde niña para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar, aparte de esto ella tiene una pequeña tienda que  está iniciando y con la que espera tener un ingreso extra para su familia, dicha tienda será atendida por sus hijos y ella seguirá trabajando como doméstica.

Con el crédito ella comprara un poco más de mercadería para ir ampliando su negocio, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, detergentes, artículos para el cuidado personal, etc  y de esta manera ella podrá tener un margen de ganancia mayor al que actualmente tiene,  comprara más producto a un precio más bajo y el costo de traslado también le dejara un poco más de ahorro ya que trasladándolo todo de una sola ves ella podrá ahorrar. 

Ella desea que en el futuro sus hijos sean personas de bien que se formen académicamente,  para que ellos puedan desempeñarse en la comunidad que tengan un trabajo estable,  para que no sufran como ella.
texts.en:
Due to a lack of financial resources, Marta, age 40, didn’t attend school.  Her parents didn’t have enough money to give her an education.  Currently, she is married; her husband works in the capital as a security guard. He only comes home every two weeks because due to his work he can’t spend more time with her and their two children.

Marta has a job as a domestic worker, because since the time she was a girl she has done that type of work.  Since she didn’t have any academic training, she has been obligated to work since she was a girl to support her family with the household expenses.  Besides this, she has a small store that she is just starting.  She hopes to get some extra income for her family with the store.  Her children will work in the store, and she will keep keep working as a maid.

With this loan she will buy a little more merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, and personal care items, to go on expanding her business.  In this way she will be able to have a better profit margin than she currently has.  She will buy more items at a lower price, and the transportation costs will also leave her a little more money, because transporting everything at once will save her money.

She hopes that in the future her children will be people of means with a good education, so that they can establish themselves in the community, have a stable job, and not suffer as she has.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, personal care items, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair spray and other inventory and to replace some of her tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children's university tuition and purchase meat products to sell on his rented stall.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a  married woman living in Bien Unido, Bohol. She works with her husband in their fishing business, which is the source of their income. Viola is asking for a loan  to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is 29 years old from Naivasha and is married to Jackson. They have two children who are three years and one year old.

Mirriam has a retail business that she has been running for the past four years and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy soft drinks, soaps, sugar, milk and bread to sell. Mirriam will used the profits to boost her business.

She hopes to improve her standards of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, soaps, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 29 years old. She is from Naivasha and is married. They have three children who are between six years and two years old. 

Lucy has a potato business that she has been running for the past three years and has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy more potatoes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and to be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, and is from Nakuru. She is married to Bernard, and they are blessed with four children aged 20, 18, 16 and 14 years old.

She has been running her business of selling livestock for the last twenty-four years, and to enable her to buy some goats for fattening and resale, she has applied for her first loan of KES.20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and she intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan, educate her children and to buy buy more livestock. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy some goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, and is from Naivasha. She is married and has four children who are aged between 20 and 13 years old. 

Mary has a livestock business that she has been running for the past ten years. She has applied for her first loan of KES.30,000 to enable her buy another heifer. Mary will use the profits to buy poultry to rear and sell as an additional source of income to add to her business.

She hopes to increase her number of cows in the near future, to help increase her milk production to 100 litres per day.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Grace and they are blessed with a 1-year-old child.

Patrick operates a welding workshop and has been in the business for four years. He earns a monthly income of KES 14,000. He has applied for his third loan of KES 45,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to expand his welding business.

He anticipates using the profits to repay his loan and to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot.

loans.use: to expand his welding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baby goats and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic compost and seedlings

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar, 25 years old, is a young and purposeful man. He is not married and lives with his parents, brother and sister in a rural area. For more than 5 years, Anvar has been growing melons, watermelons, wheat, potatoes, etc. Since he began this business, the family's living conditions have improved. Anvar likes his job. He thinks that growing vegetables is the best way for earning money in Tajikistan. He is going to make a new sowing. Anvar is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni (TJS) to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
La Sr. Máximo tiene 50 años,  es de la Ciudad de Paraguarí, es olero hace más de 10 años también tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa que emprendió hace 1 año aproximadamente.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, está casado con la Señora María de 38 años, y juntos tienen 3 hijos por quienes luchan para poder darles una vida digna.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser bebidas, carne, verduras, embutidos y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maximo is 50 years old and from the town of Paraguari.  He has been a boot black for 10 years and also has a well-stocked grocery store in his home that he started about a year ago.

He is a hardworking person, married to 38 year old Maria, and they have three children for whom they strive to provide a dignified life

He is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as beverages, meats, vegetables, sausages, and other things to stock his store and continue making sales so he can help his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Luz Omaira

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante y luchadora, cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo, tiene a cargo a sus dos hijos adolescentes a quienes ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Se desempeña como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo productos por catálogo, gracias a que una amiga le enseñó la labor, pero luego, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, decidió iniciar su propia tienda de abarrotes, aprovechando la ventaja de ser conocida en el sector por su actividad anterior, trabaja sola todos los días de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm, allí ofrece diferentes productos de la canasta familiar y ha logrado generar ingresos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos y para el sustento diario.
El propósito con el crédito es comprar una vitrina exhibidora y fortalecer su inventario con productos lácteos, carnes frías, huevos, granos, mecato, entre otros, para satisfacer la demanda actual y poder ofrecer más variedad de artículos a su clientela, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que recibe.
Luz tiene como meta a corto plazo, independizar su negocio de la unidad familiar, para lo que está trabajando en pro de conseguir un local más amplio y que le permita tener más capacidad para aumentar los inventarios, generando una mayor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica que le permita seguir apoyando a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a vivacious, hard-working woman. She has been the head of her household since separating from her husband. She has custody of her two adolescent children whom she has gotten ahead through great hard work.
Luz is an independent merchant. She started off selling products through a catalogue thanks to a friend who taught her this work. Later, with a desire to generate a better income, she decided to start her own grocery store. She took advantage of being known in the area from her previous business. She works alone every day from 7 am to 8 pm, offering various grocery products. She has been able to generate an income to pay for her children's studies and to provide their daily bread.
Her goal for this loan is to buy a display case and strengthen her inventory with dairy products, cold meats, eggs, grains, pastries, and other items in order to satisfy current demand and to offer a greater variety of articles to her customers. This will improve her sales and income.
Luz's short-term goal is to make her business independent from her family.
