El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos.
Le gusta trabajar y  pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, is married and lives with her husband and her children, ages 20, 21, and 16.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte Communal Bank is located in the Ventanilla Norte area of Ventanas Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Teresa has made a living in agriculture growing corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products from Agroquímica Briones in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same place.

Teresa's requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs for her corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family.

Her dream is to give her children an education.  She likes to work and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Doña Gloribeth es la lideresa del grupo, Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer, un grupo con mucha trayectoria y excelente moral de pago, está compuesto por 5 socias que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora,  e independiente,  tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, todo mayores de edad y con sus familias ya formadas, y que al igual que ella y su esposo trabajan en actividades agropecuarias. Toda la familia se dedica a la cría y desarrollo de ganado, además del cultivo de frutas y hortalizas. Esta nueva inversión de capital de trabajo será para la compra de animales, sus alimentos e insumos para la siembra y cuido de cultivos. Los créditos anteriores le permitieron capitalizar y ahora cuenta con animales que representan su inventario. Doña Gloribeth ha logrado muchas cosas gracias a los préstamos de Fundación Mujer  entre esos logros están contribuir con los gastos familiares, ayudar a sus nietos con los estudios, además de motivar a otras mujeres en su comunidad para que trabajen en grupo, y administren bien los recursos financiados.
texts.en: Doña Gloribeth is the leader of the group Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer, a group with a lot of history and excellent payment behavior.  It is made up of five members who will invest in agricultural activities.  She is a very hardworking and independent woman.  She is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children, all older and already with their own families, and just as her and her husband, they work in agricultural activities.  The whole family is dedicated to the raising and development of livestock, in addition to the cultivation of fruits and vegetables.  This new investment will be working capital for the purchase of animals, their food and supplies for planting and crop care.  Past loans have allowed her to capitalize and now result in animals that represent her inventory.  Doña Gloribeth has accomplished many things thanks to the loans of Fundación Mujer, among these accomplishments are contributing to her family expenses, helping her grandchildren with their studies, as well as motivating other women in her community to work together as a group and efficiently administer financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase calves, food and vitamins, and inputs for planting vegetables.

loans.name: 11-02-09 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment to sell processed food.

Phượng is 36 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member solidarity group, the 11-02-09 Trường Thi Group. Phượng supports three dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa City, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in her business for 5 years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Phượng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to sell processed food.

loans.name: Matilde Azucena

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo  y con sus hijos de 26, 34, 32, 20 y 25 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Matilde se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a cambiar su estilo de vida. Su sueño es construir su casa y mejorar en los negocios
Le gusta trabajar y ser responsable.
texts.en:
Matilde, 53, is in a common-law relationship.  She lives with her husband and her children, ages 26, 34, 20, and 25.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte is located in the Ventanilla Norte area of Ventanas Canton, where the people work in agriculture and livestock.

Matilde has made a living in agriculture growing corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there.

Matilde requested the loan to buy soil amendments and fertilizer for her corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her change her lifestyle.

Her dream is to build a house and improve in business.  She likes to work and be responsible.

loans.use: to work on her rice crop

loans.name: Kaminoi

texts.en:
Kaminoi was born in 1974. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are students and the other two are schoolboys.  Her husband is a taxi driver. Kaminoi sells women’s clothes and fabrics in a local market. She has her own selling place. She is a very sociable woman and has her regular customers. 

Kaminoi is a repeat client of IMON and Kiva. She has a good credit history. Kaminoi is asking for a loan to organize her son's wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To organize her son's wedding party

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy workshop tools and equipment.

loans.name: 3.09.809.20Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase flowers to resell.

Phương is 39 years old and she is married with one child. Phương is the group leader of the 3.09.809.20 Thiệu Dương Group of solidarity, which consists of three members. Phương lives with one dependent in the district of Thieu Hoa, a rural area in the province of Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase flowers to resell.

loans.name: 3.05.90.10.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.

Hải is 38 years old and she is married with two children. Hải is the group leader of the 3.05.90.10 Thiệu Trung Group for solidarity, which consists of four members. She lives and works in the district of Thieu Hoa, a rural area in the province of Thanh Hoa, with two dependents.

In 2012, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hải has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hải has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hải faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hải hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase processed seafood to resell.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is a borrower from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school and the other two are too young for schooling. To support her family, Chanthy does rice farming on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income and also works as a paid worker for more income. She has done this business for 11 years and she earns 28,800 KHR per day. 

Chanthy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles which she has successfully repaid. The past loans have helped her to improve her lifestyle from what it was before. Now, she is the leader of a group consisting of two people: this is the fourth loan for Chanthy and the first loan for her co-borrower. Both group members are each seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Chanthy will use her loan portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can harvest rice on time with a good income in return.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Idalyn is married with three children. Idalyn is 36 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Idalyn is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.

Idalyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Idalyn hopes to save funds in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Daniel Eduardo

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene cuatro hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Daniel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, urea, abonos, además alimento para los animales balanceados. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafios el clima por que en el invierno existe mucho problemas con las carreteras.

El sueño es comprar terrenos para construir unas chancheras y comprar mas cerdos, le gusta mucho comer mariscos los dias domingos donde una señora de la esquina.
texts.en:
Daniel, 25, is in a common-law relationship and has four children.  He lives with his wife and the children in the Desvió de los Amarillos area of Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He belongs to Pequeños Agricultores Communal Bank, located in the Desvió de los Amarillos area of Ventanas, where the people work in agriculture and livestock.

Daniel makes a living in agriculture growing corn and raising farm animals such as chickens and pigs.  With the loan he'll be able to buy inputs such as fertilizer, urea, soil amendments, and balanced feed for the animals.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

The challenge Daniel faces is the weather because in the winter there are a lot of problems with the highways.

His dream is to buy land to build some pigsties and buy more pigs.  He likes to eat shellfish on Sundays at a place on the corner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, soil amendments, and balanced feed

loans.name: Angel David

texts.es:
Angel tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con la esposa y con sus hijos de 20, 17 y 12 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Carlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia y comprarse un carro.
Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel, 46, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife and his children, ages 20, 17, and 12.  He lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte Communal Bank is located in the Ventanilla Norte area of Ventanas Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Angel has made a living growing corn and rice for several years.  He buys his products in Ventanas in Agroquímica Carlita and sells them in the market in the same place.

He requested the loan to buy soil amendments and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped him increase his income for his family.

Angel's dreams are to get ahead with his family and to buy himself a car.  He likes to work and play sports.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more supplies of pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Nasraan

texts.en:
Nasraan is a 28-year-old married woman who has been operating a business selling milk for many years. She has three cows and two calves in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with the butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life with good food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Nasraan's third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through this support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have increased milk production capacity which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Souleymane est un jeune menuisier très ambitieux, ayant à son actif plus d’une dizaine années d’expérience. Il est marié et père d’un garçon de moins d’un an. Il vient de renouveler son crédit. Il a actuellement quatre apprentis qui l’aident dans ses tâches. Sa clientèle est au-delà de sa région car bénéficiant régulièrement de commandes en provenance des autres régions. Après avoir renouveler certains outils et petits matériels avec le crédit précédent, Il  compte avec son  nouveau crédit  acheter un âne et une charrette respectivement 45 000 FCFA et 97 000 FCFA (qui lui facilitera l’approvisionnement en bois et la livraison des commandes) et le reste lui servira d’achat de tronc pour sciage et fabrication de meubles en vu de respecter ses engagements.  
Avec les retombées, il garde toujours son ambition de  rendre l’activité plus professionnelle tout en apportant soutien à sa mère dans la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Souleymane is a young and very ambitious furniture maker with more than ten years of experience. He's married and the father of one child, who was born less than one year ago.

He just renewed his loan for the same amount. In his workshop located in his neighborhood, he currently has four apprentices who help him with his work. His clientele extends outside of his region, since he regularly gets orders from other parts of the country.

After renewing some tools and small materials with the previous loan, he intends to use the new one to buy a donkey and a cart for XOF 45'000 and XOF 97'000, respectively. This will make getting wood supplies and delivering orders easier. The remainder will be used to buy trunks to be sawed and used to make furniture in order to fulfill his commitments. 

With his profits, he still has the ambition to make his business more professional, while supporting his mother in handling the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a donkey and a cart

loans.name: Maximo Evaristo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 55 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa e hijos de 37 y 25 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Máximo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Comercial López y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para fomentar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno. 
Le gusta ver la Televisión.
texts.en:
Máximo, 55, is in a common-law relationship.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 37 and 25, in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Canton.  Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte Communal Bank is located in the Ventanilla Norte area of Ventanas, where the people work in agriculture and livestock.

Máximo has made a living growing corn and rice for several years.  He buys his products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same place.

He requested the loan to buy soil amendments and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped him improve his family finances.

Máximo's dream is to buy himself a plot of land.  He likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: 3.09.901.12Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to provide a tailor-made clothing and clothing repair service.

Hương is 24 years old and she is married with one child. Hương is the group leader of the 3.09.901.12 Thiệu Dương Group of solidarity, which consists of six members. She lives and works in the district of Thieu Hoa, a rural area in the province of Thanh Hoa, with one dependent.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase machines to provide a tailor-made clothing and clothing repair service.

loans.name: 3.05.91.09.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chính has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Chính is 50 years old and she is married with two children. Chính is the group leader of the 3.05.91.09 Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in the district of Thieu Hoa, a rural area in the province of Thanh Hoa, with no additional dependents.

In 2012, Chính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chính has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chính has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chính faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chính hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: 3.05.92.02.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Lợi is 58 years old and she is married with two children. Lợi is the group leader of the 3.05.92.02 Thiệu Trung Group for solidarity, which consists of three members. She lives and works in district of Thieu Hoa, a rural area in the province of Thanh Hoa, with her two dependents.

In 2003, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lợi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la comunidad de Tela, Atlántida. Se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas. Vende tajadas con carne y pollo frito, pastelitos, desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. reside en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace un año que tiene este negocio establecido en su casa. Ella inicio con la venta de kazabe y pan de coco. Solicita 15,000 Lempiras para compra de granos básicos, refrescos, bananos verdes, carnes, verduras y otros para la elaboración de comidas y poder incrementar las ventas. Su meta es hacer que el negocio crezca y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Eulogia, 55, is a single mother.  She has one child and lives in the community of Tela, Atlántida.

Eulogia makes a living selling food and sweets.  She sells bananas with beef and with fried chicken, pastries, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She has had this business set up in her home for a year.  She started out selling cassava bread and coconut bread.

Eulogia's requesting 15,000 lempiras [NHL] to buy basic grains, beverages, green bananas, meat, vegetables, and other ingredients to make food and increase her sales.

Her goals are for her business to grow and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Balbine

texts.fr: Balbine est une femme de 61 ans célibataire et mère de deux enfants âgés de 30 et 40 ans. Elle est commerçante et dispose d'une alimentation dans laquelle elle vend des produits de première nécessité ainsi que  la boisson. son activité fonctionne bien mais elle se trouve très souvent confrontée au problème de rupture de stock ceci est  dû à la petitesse de son capital car sa clientèle qu'elle a acquis au fil du temps ne cesse de s'agrandir. C'est pour palier à ce problème qu'elle  sollicite un financement. Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter des casiers de boisson et des produits alimentaires pour agrandir sa boutique. Les bénéfices qui en résulteront seront d'une part réinvestis  dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Balbine is a 61-year old single woman and a mother of two children, aged 30 and 40 years old. 

She is a merchant and sells food products and also drinks. This business does well, but she often has gaps in her stock due to lack of capital and the growing number of customers. To solve this problem, she has requested a loan.

With this loan, she is going to buy cases of drinks and food products to expand her shop. 

Earnings will be partly reinvested in her business, and the rest will allow her to help her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks and food products

loans.name: Margaret Muthoni

texts.en:
Margaret is a wife and a mother of two girls. She is a dairy and poultry farmer with seven zerograzed cows and 300 chickens. This is her family’s source of income. It has been very expensive for her to rear the chickens since she has to use at least 10 liters of kerosine to light the rooms and two sacks of  charcoal to keep the rooms warm and for her cooking needs as well. She also has to buy batteries for her torch every week as she wakes up at 04:00am to milk every day. Her farming has a lot of potential and can be very profitable if she could cut down some of her expenses. 

By constructing a biodigester for her she would be able to reduce her fuel expenses by at least 90% by using the biogas to light and warm the chicken rooms and for her house for cooking and lighting. To produce the biogas she will use the chicken and cows' waste and after collecting the biogas she can pack the bioslurry in jerrycans and sell to other farmers or use it to grow fodder for her cows. With the biogas Margaret can be empowered to be an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to constuct a biodigester.

loans.name: Therese Yaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois inauguré un 14 décembre 2010 regroupe en son sein des femmes très organisées avec une rigueur dans le fonctionnement de leur groupement. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent de liens de solidarité voir parenté très solide. Elles font le petit commerce et diverses activités génératrices de revenu.

Madame Thérèse (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est la représentante du groupe. Malgré son jeune âge 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'une fille et d'un garçon c’est une femme très ambitieuse et rigoureuse. Elle est vendeuse de « fataya » beignet salé à base de farine de blé accompagné de sauce à la tomate et du poisson cuit à l’intérieur. Elle renouvelle chaque trois jour son stock.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 5 Kg de farine, un litre d’huile, ½ Kg de poisson frais de l’oignon et divers ingrédients pour la préparation.

Les bénéfices obtenus de cette activité lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et de mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en: This borrowing group started on 14 December 2010 and brings together very organized women who are serious about their group's operations. They all live in the same village and share strong family ties.  They are small business owners engaged in various income-generating activities.  Ms. Therese (standing at the far right with her left hand raised) is the representative of this group.  Despite her young age (26), she is married and mother of a daughter and a son. She is a very ambitious and disciplined woman. She sells "fataya" doughnuts made of salted flour, accompanied by tomato sauce with cooked fish inside. Every three days she replenishes her inventory.  With her new loan, she plans to buy 5 kg of flour, 1 liter of oil, 1/2 kg of fresh fish, onion, and various ingredients for preparation.  The profits earned from this business will enable her to increase her savings and to better help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 5 kg of flour, 1 liter of oil, 1/2 kg of fresh fish and various ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Ce groupement est l’un des meilleurs de la région. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aby (assise  à droite), est la représentante de ce groupe. Elle est  âgée de 56 ans,  elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. C’est une femme très engagée dans les activités du groupement. Elle est vendeuse de chaussures de fabrication locale, elle fait aussi des draps et des bracelets.

Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer son commerce par l’achat en quantité :  
-	Chaussures pour homme et femme.
-	Des tissus pour la confection de drap et divers fils.
-	Et le reste servira à acheter des produits de mercerie.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux asseoir son commerce et elle compte acquérir un réfrigérateur.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women with great determination when it comes to their profit-generating activities. They have a long experience with the “banc villageois” (lending organization) program, and have shown a solidary mindset allowing them to face many situations. This group is one of the best in this region. Their main activity is retail.
Madame Aby (sitting on the right) is the representative of the group. She is 56 years old, married, and a mother of seven—four boys and three girls. She is very committed to the group’s activities. She sells locally-manufactured shoes, and also makes sheets and bracelets.
With this loan, she is planning on strengthening her retail business by purchasing wholesale:
-	Men and women’s shoes
-	Fabrics to make sheets and various threads
-	With the remainder, various accessories sold by the dozen, to be retailed individually.
Profits from her activity will allow her to strengthen her business; she is also planning to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabric, bed linens and haberdashery

loans.name: Osiris

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Osiris en la compra de hilos telas, botones y otros insumos hoy atiende mejor a su clientela pues tiene nuevos productos, por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva “Muchas gracias por su apoyo y que Dios los bendiga” En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará telas en mayor volumen y tendrá mucho éxito porque responderá a los pedidos de su clientela.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Osiris in the purchasing of thread, fabric, buttons, and other supplies. Today she can serve her customers better since she has new products. For this, she sends the following message to the lenders at Kiva: "Thank you so much for your support and God bless you." Currently she is applying for a CrediKiva, with which she will buy fabric in large amounts and have lots of success because she will fill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric in large amounts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Wendwaogo 5 Mogtedo 5 Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZARATA  représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 5 MOGTEDO 5. Mariée, elle est mère de 01 enfant. Il est  âgé de 02ans et ne va pas à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. Ses clients sont  les femmes de Pouytenga  et  Ouagadougou et  Mogtedo.
Elle veut s’acheter 01tone de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto ou un vélo selon les moyens  que Dieu lui donnera pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Zarata is the representative of the Wendwaogo 5 Mogtedo 5 Group. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old child who does not attend school. She has two dependents.

Zarata has been a rice steamer for the past ten years. She purchases her merchandise in Mogtedo. Her clients are the women of Pouytenga, Ouagadougou, and Mogtedo. She wants to use her loan to purchase one ton of rice.

With her income, Zatara wants to improve her business. She aims to buy a motorcycle or a bicycle according to the means that God provides for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one ton of rice.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat, age 49, is a married woman who has been in business making shoes for many years. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality shoes and makes enough to contribute to the family income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now, she requested a loan of Rs. 45000 to buy raw materials such as leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family. She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing a better standard of living to her four children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, artificial leather and plastic soles.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya de Hamdallaye préfecture de Koutiala, Région de Sikasso, sont toutes dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents, elles se connaissent très bien. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ces femmes de Danaya vendent de divers produits tels que, Condiments, Céréales, Tissus, Indigo et divers. Pour valoriser et élargir leur activité génératrice de revenu, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe.    
La deuxième assise de la droite s’appelle Nana, elle est une vendeuse de bazins de diverses couleurs, blanc, verte, jaune, rouge et autre couleurs du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de bazin et des colorants à Koutiala. Elle les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180 000f CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle  Mme Nana   compte réaliser 200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter leur stock.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are from Hamdallaye in the Koutiala prefecture and Sikasso region. They are all in traditional families with their husbands, children, other relatives. They know one another very well. On average, they are 29 years old, married, and have at least three children.

These women from the Danaya group sell various products such as condiments, cereals, fabric, indigo, etc. In order to enhance and expand their revenue-generating activities, they decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fifth group loan. 

The woman seated second from the right, Nana, sells bazin (damask) fabric in various colors - white, green, yellow, red, and other colors. She would like to use her loan to buy pieces of bazin fabric and fabric dyes in Koutiala. They sell them for credit out of their homes and at the market to a diverse clientele. 

While the other members of the Danaya group each want to earn an average monthly profit of 180,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, Madame Nana would like to earn 200,000 FCFA.

In addition to reimbursing their loans, they use one part of their revenue to pay their personal expenses and grow their business. 

They would like to reinforce this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their stock.

loans.use: bazin (damask) fabric and fabric dyes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and farming tools

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankélé de Koutiala  (Darsalam I) est un regroupement de femmes qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, sont mariées et au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Habits, Condiments, Fruits et Légumes, Calebasses, louches, etc.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe. 
Djelika est un membre du groupe Kankélé est vendeuse de divers articles : Calebasse, Louches (Galama) et autres,   elle est devant et debout  aux milieux devant ses produits en face sur les chaises.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 300 calebasses et 500 louches africaines (Galama). Elle se procure de ces articles au grand marché et les villages. Elle vend ces articles au comptant à la maison et au marché et souvent à Abidjan la capitale ivoirienne à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres  du groupe Kankélé comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 186 000 XOF chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Djelika compte réaliser  200.000 XOF.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Group Kankélé of Koutiala (Darsalam I) is a group of women living in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 43 years old, most of them are married, and they have at least five children.
This women’s group trades in various items such as clothing, condiments, fruits and vegetables, calebasses, ladles, etc.
To develop their business, the members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their eleventh group loan.
Djelika, a member of group Kankélé, sells various items: gourds, ladles (galamas), and more. She is standing in the front row, behind her products on the chairs.
She is planning on using her loan to purchase 300 calabasses and 500 shady African gourds (Galama). She procures these items at the great market and in villages. She retails them from her home and at the market, and often also in Abidjan, the Ivorian capital, to a diverse clientele.
While the other members of group Kankélé are anticipating an average profit of 186,000 XOF each, for this cycle, Mrs. Djelika is planning on 200,000 XOF.
In addition to repaying their loans, they use part of the profit to handle their personal expenses and to increase their working capital.

loans.use: to purchase 300 calabasses and 500 shady African gourds (Galama)

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
Belarmina is from Cortes, Bohol. She 52 years old and married with five children. She has been running a sari sari (a variety store business) for several years. She sells commodities like canned goods, detergent, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and toiletries. 

Belarmina is asking for a loan to buy more stock items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, bath soap and soy sauce to resell. Belarmina dreams of making her business a success. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, bath soap and soy sauce

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a married woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with five grown children. She earns a living by selling homemade meals. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat and seasonings. With the additional inputs, she hopes to increase her sales.

In the future, Perpetua hopes to expand her food vending business and to increase her business' profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat and seasonings

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia tiene una edad de 47 años ella es agricultora y ama de casa, con una familia muy numerosa la cual está compuesta por 11 hijos involucrándose en los trabajos de campo junto a su padre 9 de ellos ya que los primeros dos viven en hogares aparte. De sus 9 hijos 4 de ellos estudian en diferentes grados de educación y al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayudan a sus hermanos y padre a desarrollar las actividades como: poda, aplicación de fertilizantes, recolección del grano, entre otras. A parte del trabajo de campo como agricultora ella cuenta con un molino de moler maíz y uno de café siendo sus clientes los mismos habitantes de la zona. Su principal actividad como medio de ingresos es el café desde hace muchos años y por generaciones siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Sus cultivos de café son propios por los que da gracias a Dios por no trabajar ajeno y mantener las ganancias para su familia ubicados a 30 minutos de camino en la cual se involucran ellos como familia. 
Sus planes para el futuro poder ampliar más sus tierras para sembrar una variedad de café y ofrecer a sus clientes, también sembrar hortalizas entre otros que ayuden a fortalecer el patrimonio y los ingresos para su hogar para así poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para poder invertirlo en sus cultivos de café y dar el mantenimiento que necesita para poder obtener una buena producción y llevar a cabo sus planes.
texts.en:
Alicia, 47, is a farmer and a homemaker.  She has a very large family made up of eleven children, nine of whom are involved in farm work with their father, because the oldest two live in separate homes.  Four of her nine children are at different levels of education, and when they're done with their student activities they help their siblings and their father with pruning, applying fertilizer, harvesting, and other tasks.

In addition to her work as a farmer, Alicia has a corn mill and a coffee mill; her customers are the area residents.  Her main job as a means of income has been coffee for many years--and for generations because her parents taught her to work the land at a young age.

Her coffee crops are her own, for which she gives thanks to God for not having to work for others and for being able to keep her profits for her family.  It's a 30-minute walk to her land, and all the family is involved. 

Alicia's plans for the future are to be able to expand her land more to plant a variety of coffee to sell to her customers.  She also wants to grow vegetables and other things to strengthen her patrimony and her household income and to support her children in their studies.

This is why Alicia's currently requesting a loan to invest in her coffee crop.  She's going to provide the necessary maintenance to be able to get a good harvest and realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants

loans.name: Guillermina Olga

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 56 años es casada con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica al preparado de budines queques alfajores  para luego expenderlos en forma ambulatoria. Y a la vez se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos.  El préstamo lo invertirá en la cuota inicial de una refrigeradora.  Ya que tiene como finalidad empezar a preparar torta helada gelatina. Su  mayor deseo  es adquirir un stand. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado
texts.en: Guillermina is 56 years old, married, with independent children. She works selling pastries door-to-door. At this time she also works selling beauty products through catalogs. She will invest this loan in the first payment on a refrigerator for the purpose of beginning to prepare frozen jello cakes. Guillermina's biggest wish is to have her own stand. She appreciates the Kiva investors for the loan being offered.

loans.use: EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRA EN LA CUOTA INICIAL DE UNA REFRIGERADORA

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution.
Mme AMI  (2ème de la gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 5 colis de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi gorup are married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Fakola - one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully run their businesses at all times. This is their second loan with the institution. 

Madame Ami (second person from the left in the photo) would like to buy five packages of condiments with her loan. She sells at the market daily and is sought after - especially on market days. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA. This income will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 49 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have eight children. 

With the loan, she would like to buy sand to make more bricks for sale. With the profits from the business, she plans to add to her savings.

She has gained much from the previous loan; that's why she has been motivated to reinvest again. Another loan, if provided, will help her to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sand to make more bricks for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 14 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with a high population and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometime there is no water. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more water tanks to store water for sale. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to supply water to area residents. She also keeps poultry which she sells to earn more income. She will use the anticipated profits to buy poultry feeds and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more water tanks to store water for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 31 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with two children aged 11 and 8 who are attending school.

Richard is in the transport business. He uses his bicycle to ferry his customers for a fee. 

To enable him to buy two more bicycles for increased income, he has applied for his second loan of 16,500 KES from VisionFund Kenya. His monthly income right now is 10,000 KES and he hopes to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan to VisionFund, educate his children, and start a business for his spouse.

In the future, Richard hopes to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy two more bicycles for use in transportation of passengers for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material along with general stock.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 45-year-old woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest child is 25 and the youngest is 10. She operates a sari-sari store to help her husband who is a carpenter and a farmer. 

In her store, Juliet sells items like coffee, canned goods, eggs, detergent, milk, sugar and snack foods. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of sugar, coffee, canned goods, eggs and noodles. The loan enable her to add more inventory before she runs out of stock. Her income will pay for healthy meals and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, coffee, canned goods, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 49 years old, is from Naivasha and is married with four children who are in school.

Nancy has a dairy farming business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy animal feeds and concentrates.

She hopes to be a prominent dairy farmer in the near future and be able to produce 100 litres of milk, up from the 20 litres that she currently gets.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and concentrates.
